Traditionally, the Anstalt organization is established in Liechtenstein by an authorized person who is appointed to conduct business in this state. The authorized person has the power to establish an organization on the basis of trust documents, on his own behalf, but in the client's interests.

After the “KYC” principle has been introduced, it is necessary to indicate the legal entity that has the authority to support the registration and further activities of the company.

General rules for the ANSTALT company
registration in LiechtensteinLinguistic cultureThe task (objective)An authorized capitalAn institutionBusiness ActivitiesSupreme Management BodyAdministrative AuthorityOfficialsBeneficiariesAccountingDeclarationThe time of a company registration DissolutionTax system and revenues

The name of the organization can be easily created in any language (it should be submitted in Latin letters). The name of the organization can be reserved. Special permission must be obtained if you want to use regional or international names of the states or places in the organization title in Liechtenstein.

The official language in the country is German. The translation of the Legislative Act on the formation of the organization in Liechtenstein from the German is filed on the first demand.

The task of the company in Liechtenstein is to carry out any types of the entrepreneurial activity not prohibited by the Liechtenstein legislation, for example, trade in products, services, Asset management, financing, property management, rentals, control over the assets of beneficiaries, funds.

Banking activities can be carried out by the banking institutions only; third party's assets may only be managed by licensed trustees. Foundations can only be engaged in non-commercial activities

According to the law, the authorized capital of an Anstalt company in Liechtenstein can be recorded in Swiss francs, euros and US dollars. The minimum authorized capital requirement is 30 000 CHF. The authorized capital can be formed in cash and in-kind.

Legal entities in Liechtenstein, as well as trust companies, are being established in accordance with the Articles of Association, that must be filed to the competent authorities. Companies in Liechtenstein can be established by one or more natural persons or a legal entity.

The only exception is a joint stock company, that requires at least two founders to incorporate. It is possible to establish a company by the Power of Attorney.

A Joint-stock company, a limited liability company, a trust company and a fund undertake to fulfill the obligation of the initial registration in the State Register (the Commercial company register).

Every legal entity, pased the registration process in Liechtenstein, as well as trust companies, require a supreme management body (a founders meeting, owner of the founder rights or another authority), that has the right to make decisions on behalf of the company.

At least one of the management board members (Board of directors, Board of trustees, Foundation council or Trustee) must have a registered office in Liechtenstein and must also have certain professional qualifications.

An administrative body in Liechtenstein, consisting of any number of natural or legal persons located in Liechtenstein or abroad, has the right to consolidate. The administrative authority is the executive body of the Liechtenstein organization.

The official representative, according to the regional database, is the official receiver and the connecting link with the authorities, for example, with the Tax administration and the State registration authority. The legislation does not provide the trust companies with the official representative.

The shareholders of the companies in Liechtenstein have the right for the company profits and property in the process of its activities, as well as for the remaining assets after dissolution.

In the case of a foundation, trust companies and partnerships, the beneficiaries who are entitled to income and / or assets are assigned by the founder, by the Charter, or by another authority.

The legislation requires all legal entities and trust companies to maintain their ledgers. Foundations and trust companies are legally exempt from this regulation.

The ledgers can be kept in any legal currency, including any freely convertible currency, as well as in English, French, Italian, Spanish or Portuguese.

The annual report, that, under certain circumstances, is required to be submitted to the Liechtenstein tax administration, with a translation into German.

Organizations, enterprises and registered foundations that do not carry out their commercial activities and their task, according to the charter, does not provide the implementation of such activities (therefore, only investment and asset management or the inclusion of participation shares, or other rights that, in fact, do not imply commercial activities) provide reports on the assets and liabilities every year.

For this reason, the Liechtenstein administrative authority must provide the official confirmation to the Department of the State Registration, that a report of the assets and liabilities is available and there was no commercial activity in the previous year (no statement of assets and liabilities should be submitted).

It takes no more than a week to register a company in Liechtenstein.

A legal entity, entered in the state register for dissolution, as well as the Trust Company, cannot be liquidated until six months after the convening of the third line of creditors. Deposit funds and trust companies can be legally expelled from the register within a few days. The main reason for deregistration, in all cases, is the decision of dissolution.

In the case of companies incorporated as limited liability companies / holding companies, income or asset gains are not subject to a capital gains tax or income tax in Liechtenstein.

A) The stamp duty or an organization fee must be paid after registration of a company in Liechtenstein.
During the establishing of a limited liability company, joint stock company, cooperative, the stamp duty is one percent if the capital amount exceeds CHF 1.000.000. The same fee should be paid for capital increases too.

A registration fee or a deposit fee is required to be paid after registration. The fee depends on the capital and legal form and should be paid after entering the state register, or submitting the incorporation documentation for preservation, as required by law. In the case of a limited liability company, fees must be added for the preparation of the statutory state documentation regarding the founding procedure, as well as the costs of the statutory announcements in the official press.

B) The following taxes should be paid after registration of a company in Liechtenstein, according to the relevant system:
A الضريبة على الشركات — A Capital gains tax. All legal entities, as well as trust companies and trust communities, must pay capital tax — one-tenth of a net assets percent, but not less than CHF 1000.00 – per year.
A Tax deduction at source — 4 per cent.
Taxation on securities.
In general, it is 0.15% for securities of Switzerland and Liechtenstein and 0.3% for securities of other countries. Liechtenstein banking institutions and brokers are generally responsible for payments, as well as others if they are involved in saling and purchasing of securities.
Value added taxation (VAT)
On January 1, 1995, the turnover tax (called WUST) was replaced by value added tax (VAT). Liechtenstein holding companies and local businesses are exempt from VAT if they have no turnover by the country.

It permits to have an American company with the same advantages as with an offshore International Business Company.

American LLCs, structured for the tax regime of partnerships with non-residents, who do not conduct business in the US and do not have any income from America — are not subject to US federal income tax and are not required to submit a US income tax report. The Limited Liability Company name should consist the words LLC or LC for Limited Company in the final position. It is forbidden to use the names of companies that have been registered earlier or similar to such names. Also, it is not allowed to use words such as bank, trust, insurance, or reinsurance in the form of an LLC, as an LLC cannot engage in banking or insurance activities.

Switzerland

Registration of a company in Switzerland

Registration of a company in Switzerland is a popular jurisdiction choice for several reasons. There are a very attractive tax system, loyal legislation even for non-residents, and a steady political and economic situation.

All these factors have made Switzerland extremely popular among the foreign businessmen seeking to establish their company in this region.

It is difficult to cooperate with the government authorities in a foreign country, without knowledge of the local language, legislation and percularities of the paperwork. Acalista group offers the services to everyone who have decided to register a company in Switzerland.

First, you need to figure out the purpose of a company establishment and choose the most optimal legal form of the organization. It is extremely difficult to do it without the experts advice and support.

Switzerland consists of 26 cantons. The legal entities organization in each canton are governed by a separate legislation. The Swiss tax system also has a complex structure.

Tax collection can be carried out at different levels: municipal, cantonal, federal, that determines the interest rate of the tax. The lowest taxes are charged in Zurich and Zug.

Swiss business rules
for non-residents

Since the registration of a company has done, it is necessary to arrange its activities. If the founder does not live in Switzerland constantly, it is necessary to supply the representation of the interests and legal support.

Forms of companies ownership
According to the Swiss law

Swiss law provides only two legal forms of organizations that can be registered on its territory.

  • A Limited Liability Company. At least one of the directors must be a Swiss citizen. Whilst the documents are filled for the state company registration, the founders must pay no less than 20,000 Swiss francs. Each year, a legal entity must submit the reports in the appropriate forms, provided by the legislation of a particular canton.
  • A Joint-stock company. The directors of the company are appointed by the founders, there are no specific requirements for their citizenship, but one of them must be a Swiss citizen. The amount of the joint stock company authorized capital is from 100,000 Swiss francs. Every year you need to submit an information about the accounting transactions, turnover of goods and income. In some cases, such a company is required to be audited annualy.

Business owners of another country can open a branch in Switzerland. At the same time, the parent company is still the founder; there are no specific requirements for the amount of the authorized capital. The only one requirement is that one employee of the management team should live in Switzerland.

There is no need to collect a huge package of documents for the branch registration. Moreover, a preferential tax rate applies to the branches income received in the state.

For more information about each of the forms, contact the Acalista group specialists. Qualified team will answer all questions and provide with more detailed specifics of each company type.

Registration of a LTD in Great Britain

A limited liability company is an organization that is a distinct legal structure with its privale property, the assets of the company are separated from personal finances.

Any income it makes are owned by the company after the company has paid a الضريبة على الشركات. The company can share its profits.

LTD ownership
in Great Britain

Every limited liability company has "founders" — people or organizations that own the company shares.

The directors are responsible for the company management. The shares are usually owned by the directors, but it's not a necessary obligation.

There are many legal responsibilities associated with the duties of director and management of a limited liability company.

Limited by shares

Most limited liability companies are “limited by shares”. It means that shareholders' liability for company financial obligations is limited by the value of shares they own but have not paid.

The directors of the company are not responsible for the company debts unless they have broken the law.

If you are a director of a limited liability company, you must:

  • Complete and submit a tax declaration every year
  • Pay tax and insurance through the PAYE system if the company pays your salary.

Your liability for company debts differs depending on the ownership of the commandite partnership and the limited partnership

In both types of companies, you can split a whole income between partners. Each partner pays tax on his profits share.

Responsibility for debts that cannot be paid during a limited partnership activities is shared between the partners.

"General" partners are personally responsible for the company's debts "

Limited partners are liable up only to the amount paid in the partnership capital.

General partners are also responsible for business management.

Partners in an LLP are not personally liable for the company's debts — their responsibility is limited by the amount of money they invest in the business.

The responsibilities and profit shares of the Partners are set out in the Partnership Agreement. “Appointed members” have additional responsibilities.

Each year, the partnership must send the partnership's Self Assessment — the tax return to HMRC.

  • To file a personal tax return every year
  • To pay income tax on their share of the partnership's profits
  • To pay for a national insurance

The partnership should also be registered with VAT if the profit is expected to be more than £ 83,000 per year.

Austria is welcoming the foreign investors by a thriving sophisticated business center and a traditional trading bridge located in Eastern Europe and the Balkans.

The tax policy of Austria does not provide the control for the offshore countries, it has several tax agreements, for example, with Belize, Hong Kong, the United Arab Emirates (Dubai).

Complex tax minimization structures are intended for all types of business — trade, holding structures, investment or royalty companies. With efficient tax planning and restructuring, the effective tax rate can be below 3-5%.

There are unlimited possibilities for using the existing Austrian organization due to the tax planning. A company, incorporated in Austria can be exempted from dividends and foreign capital gains taxes, even if the foreign legal entity is located in an offshore jurisdiction.

Austria does not accept C.F.C. legislation, nor any thin capitalization rules or debt-to-equity ratio. Therefore, you can get benefit from the Austrian company by purchasing funds for investment.

Any interest, received from this loan, is completely tax exempt. There is no withholding tax on payments to the foreign creditors, even if the interest is paid to an offshore company or jurisdictions without a double taxation treaty.

The company in Austria is ideal option for a royalty company — for the purpose of obtaining royalties on patents or other intellectual property from subsidiaries and third parties. More than 60 Avoidance of double taxation agreements have been signed, and many countries have reduced the tax rates or have 0% rate on incoming and outgoing royalties.

Since Austria is a member of the EU, the Savings and Royalties EU Directive can be applied. It provides that, as long the parent company owns at least 10% of the subsidiary shares within the European Union for at least one year, there are no withholding tax levied on the payment of royalties to the Austrian company.

CORPORATE INCOME TAX (CIT): The standard rate is 25%. With the efficient tax planning and restructuring, the effective tax rate can be lower than 3-5%.

INCOMING DIVIDENDS: 0% overall for EU and countries with the tax treaties.

Capital Gains Tax (CGT): Companies are generally taxed at the standard الضريبة على الشركات rate, although the reductions and exemptions are widely applied, as the result, an effective rate is 0%.

REPATRIATION TAX:

Royalty: 0% or reduced according to the tax treaty or the EU Directive. Otherwise, the tax rate is 20%.

DIVIDENDS: 0% or reduced for the dividends paid by an EU entity or treaty of jurisdiction. Otherwise, the tax rate is 25%.

INTEREST: As a general rule, no withholding tax is charged on interest.

VALUE ADDED TAX (VAT). EU VAT regime. The standard rate for the internal sales is 20%.

The specific feature of the Andorra legislation is the lack of possibility to buy a turnkey offshore company. It is not profitable and almost impossible. According to the laws of Andorra, the Articles of Association must describe the planned activities in the minute detail.

All future operations are accurately spelled out and submitted to the authorities.

This fact greatly distinguishes the country from other jurisdictions. In Andorra, it is impossible to start selling cars, and then hold a board of directors and switch to producing the computers under the same name of company. However, this country is great for a company registration.

Despite the strict legislation for anti money-laundering, Andorra provides a good climate for doing business. Low taxes also have a positive effect on the company development. It is also important that the taxes in Andorra are fixed, easily calculated and predicted. It makes work and financial reporting much easier.

The registration procedure is transparent, but requires learning the system. However, the Andorran laws impose a number of small requirements to the company. They are simple, but need some effort to fulfill them.

Implementation of the popular companies in Estonia

of a company in Estoniaحول البلد

Estonian limited liability company OÜ is appropriate for the commercial purposes. A special الضريبة على الشركات system provides the tax payment in the case of the profit distribution only. There are no taxes for the accumulated retained earnings.

CORPORATE INCOME TAX (CIT): the tax refers to the actual profits distribution, mainly to the distributed dividends that have been distributed. The payable tax is 20/80 of the net income (20% of the turnover).

INCOMING DIVIDENDS: The 5% rate applies when dividends are paid to a company (other than a partnership) that holds at least 10% of the company payer's capital; otherwise, the rate is 10%. Estonia does not impose an income tax on dividends.

Capital gains tax (CGT): capital gains are considered as a regular income and are taxed by distribution.

Repatriation tax: since the الضريبة على الشركات applies only to the distribution of profits, there is no separate withholding tax.

Bilateral tax treaties for the avoidance of double taxation BILATERAL 56 countries, including Malta and the UAE.

VALUE ADDED TAX (VAT). EU VAT regime. The standard rate for the internal sales is 20%.

The Estonian economy has rapidly grown in recent years, due to the liberal policies, implemented during accession to the EU. Estonia has been a member of the Eurozone since 2011. Preferential economic conditions – Bahrain

Recently, the opening of the offshore companies in Bahrain has become especially popular.

It is rather difficult to choose a suitable country and register an enterprise there by yourself. Thereby, it is better to contact a company that specializes in the opening of the offshore companies, and predicts all possible problems, can select the favorable conditions, depending on the client's business.

One of the rather interesting options is the opening of an enterprise in Bahrain.

Bahrain
is an analogue of the UAE business market

Bahrain is a developing Arab state, focused on variety and diversification of business development. This country also attracts with stability, incentives for investment and a tax-free economic zone (no VAT).

ПThere are three main types of a company registration:

  • A With Limited Liability (WLL) Company – it is enough to have two founders and the same عدد المديرين. The authorized fund is about 53 thousand US dollars (20 thousand Bahraini dinars BHD) and is paid at once. An audit is carried out annually.
  • A Joint Stock Company (BSC) – there must be at least two investors or shareholders, and at least three directors. The authorized capital is 250 thousand BND. 50% is paid before registration, the rest can be paid within three years. Reporting is submitted once a year, after an audit.
  • A Single Personal Company (SPC) – individual or private enterprise, therefore the director and owner are the same person. The authorized investment is 50 thousand BND. The report is submitted once a year, as with any other form of ownership.

Additional requirements for the registration of an offshore company:

  • The office must be located in the country;
  • A license is required for some types of business;
  • An income tax exemption (It does not apply to the gas and oil business)
The required package of documents
for the company registration in Bahrain

For registration of a company as an individual, it is enough to submit a copy of the passport (all pages), a document confirming the address (e.g., the utility bill).

A legal entity will need a copies of the major co-owners passports. The copies of corporate documents must be certified.

After the registration procedure is completed, you will get:

  • a Company registration certificate;
  • a Share certificate;
  • Minutes of the meeting of founders or shareholders;
  • Articles of association;
  • ختم الشركات.

Business conditions
in the Sultanate of Brunei

Brunei is an ideal place for business establishment and development: the state offers comfortable conditions for both local businessmen and non-resident investors. Moreover, the country's currency is reliable and stable.

There are four forms of business organizations in Brunei Darussalam, as well as in other countries. But there are some restrictions for the foreign investors. Therefore, a businessman from another country cannot conduct a private business in Brunei.

Other forms (partnership, open-type and closed-type joint stock companies, a branch of a foreign company) do not have such prohibitions. For the partnership establishment, non-residents of the Sultanate must obtain a special permition from the Department of Immigration, Economic Planning and Development, as well as from the Ministry of Labor.

All companies are required to submit financial statements regularly, but an audit is not necessary. At the same time, there is no currency control. The taxation system is well-to-do for the foreign investors. They should not pay:

  • a duty;
  • an income tax;
  • a الضريبة على الشركات;
  • a stamp duty tax;
  • a capital gains tax.

However, a corporate income tax reaches 30%. But the resident companies pay tax on a whole income (received within and outside the country), and the foreign organizations – only on the profits earned within the jurisdiction.

The main terms of the international business registration in Brunei: a local registered office and resident agent, closed access to reporting (confidentiality of data), information about the form of organization in the name, prohibition on the share capital payment in local currency (Brunei dollar), a local cityzen secretary.

However, the director does not have to be a resident of the sultanate. Meetings can be held in any country. Another condition – the name of the organization should not contain the Cyrillic. Remarkably, the Brunei Darussalam authorities have signed an agreement with 12 countries to avoid double taxation.

The United Arab Emirates, and the emirate of Ras al-Khaimah as well, is not regulated by the EU and is not a member of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). It means that the country does not participate in the foreign automatic exchange of information.

Ras Al Khaimah (RAK) is located in the northern part of the UAE, bordering Oman. It is one of the seven emirates that formed the United Arab Emirates up.

The emirate covers the area of 1,684 square kilometers. Earlier it was known for the maritime shipbuilding and commercial activities, and now it is famous for the industrial sector.

The new legislation and regulations passed by the UAE authorities contributed the strong interest to the financial and investment sector in the RAK; as the result there are a lot of investment and business opportunities for individuals and companies around the world.

An International Business Company in RAK can do business internationally, own the real estate in the UAE, be used as a logistics company, maintain bank accounts, etc.

If the client's KYC documents (a copy of the passport and a proof of residence address, issued within the last 3 months) and a description of the proposed economic activity are received, and a verification is carried out by our legal department, we will register the company in the UAE — Ras Al Khaimah.

The RAK IBC are not allowed to do the commercial activities in the UAE. Any legal activity is permitted, except of the insurance, reinsurance, banking and investment activities on behalf of third parties.

The name of the company in the UAE — the RAK IBC should end with "Limited" or "Ltd". Prohibited names include: implying the government patronage, any connection with the financial sector, of any country or city, any name containing an abbreviation with no valid explanation, and any name that contains a registered trademark that is not owned by the company.

Other restrictions apply to the names that have already been registered or names that are similar to those that have been registered. In addition, it is prohibited to use names that are considered misleading, obscene or offensive.

in Georgia

Virtual zones in Georgia

Attracting of the investments is a great stimulus for the Georgian economy development. That was a reason for the adoption of the Virtual Zones Expanding Law in Georgia, that provides the tax exemptions for the companies involved in the computer technology. Such companies do not pay national taxes in the state.

Registration of a virtual enterprise
in Georgia

The main goal of the Georgian government is to create such conditions for doing business that would increase the investments and the development of the information technology sphere.

Due to the Virtual Zones Expanding Law, the tax incentives are provided to the companies, that develop the IT sector. Persons who have received a virtual status are exempted from national taxes paying. Moreover, they are exempt from paying a number of other taxes: income, value added, customs.

After the law adoption, it has become much easier to open an IT technology company in Georgia. There are no difficulties in the registration procedure and paying taxes. A person, who has received a virtual zone confirmation certificate, can carry out the company's activities without third party regulation.

Today, all legal entities, that want to start a business in this sphere, are not required to obtain a license. Simple registration procedure has attracted more foreign companies that want to deal with computer technologies in Georgia.

The aim of the law is to develop the computer technologies in the country and attract new investments. Now you can obtain the confirmation certificates of this status electronically. In order to get it, you need to contact the relevant authorities. Timeline for its receiving – during a weekday.

With a focus on an enacting the law, the Georgian government has made a number of amendments to the normative and legislative acts to comply with the adopted law. Also, the Tax Code has changes that relate to the preferential taxation of companies operating in the IT sector in Georgia.

The new law would contribute to the computer technology development. She also added that now in Georgia there are special virtual zones where companies are exempt from paying taxes.

But according to this law, the companies engaged in computer technology are exempt from taxation in the country.

It has become much easier and more profitable to start and conduct a business. It led to the rapid development of the information sphere.

Procedure of obtaining
a virtual zone person status

The activities of companies engaged in computer technology are governed by the adopted legislation and regulations.

The special attention in the Virtual Zones Law is paid to the order and procedure of obtaining a status that confirms the virtual zone person. In order to get this status, you need to contact a person authorized by the government. The status is assigned within 10 days after the request.

After that, the person, who received the status, needs to get an electronic certificate. It is issued within 48 hours after obtaining the status of a virtual zone person.

The legal entities that have received a certificate in electronic form can start doing business without a license and other documents. Persons who have been assigned the status of a virtual zone person must engage in the economic sphere that develop the information industry in the country.

Afret the Law takes effect, the tax is not imposed to:

  • the income, received from the supplies outside the administrative border of Georgia;
  • the supplies, that have been carried out abroad, including VAT;
  • the exportations that were carried as export payment from customs.

After the Law takes effect, the Georgian IT market began its rapid development. It became interesting for the foreign companies, who want to prevent the possible risks. They started making a software in Georgia, that eventually is not very expensive. The Law has made the favorable conditions for the business development in the IT sector.

A simple registration procedure contributes to a great interest for doing business in the computer technology sphere in Georgia. A willing can go through the procedure of getting an electronic certificate, that will be needed to conduct business in the IT sector. It is possible by visiting the online resource of the government of Georgia.

Canada

Registration of a company in Canada

Canada is a country with a quite strict taxation system. The ordinary Canadian companies income is taxed worldwide.

Thereby, they do not have the characteristics related to the tax or offshore structures, and are certainly prestigious.

However, the legislation of Canada offers the possibility of registering and using Canadian businesses with a zero tax rate. They are known as the LP companies.

The LP is a Limited Liability Partnership managed by at least 2 partners: a General Partner and others – Limited Partners.

If a Canadian LP with non-resident members does not conduct business and receive an income in Canada, it is not taxed in Canada, in fact it is equal to an offshore company

Canadian tax legislation does not treat LP as a separate subject of taxation. Founders ("Partners") must pay taxes on the income received by the LP company at their residence place, in proportion to their shares in LP, if this is provided by the legislation of that country.

Tax treaties
in Canada

The offshore LP companies are not considered to be residents for taxation in Canada and therefore are not eligible to use the Double Tax Treaties signed by Canada with other countries.

Registration of a company in Canada is a prestigious choice. Jurisdiction is not blacklisted by any countries and has no restrictions on cooperation with residents of any states.

Acalista group will register a Canadian LP company in accordance with the personal wishes.

The price of annual support services depends on the province of the partnership registration. The services will include an annual government fee, full payment to the registered agent / office), a General Power of Attorney for the current year.

Registration timeline – 2-3 weekdays, then legalization of the documents.

of a Canadian LP

Limited Partnership

In Canada, the LP partnerships should have at least 2 partners – individuals or legal entities from any jurisdiction. Information about partners is submitted to the Canada's Business Register where the partnership is established.

Canadian LP partners have shareholder status.

There are no compulsory requirements for a company secretary.

The minimum authorized capital in a Canadian LP is 1,000 CAD. There is no legal requirement for a full or partial payment of a capital for registration.

A company name of Canadian LP must end with the words “Limited Partnership” (LP). Company names containing words such as "Bank", "Insurance", "Trust", etc., are not permitted until the company obtaines the appropriate national license.

Information about an ultimate beneficial ownership must be disclosed to the registered agent and be kept confidentially by the agent.

Every Canadian LP should keep appropriate records and prepare the financial statements.

Companies with non-resident partners that do not conduct business in Canada, do not receive any income from sources in Canada, and that are managed and controlled outside Canada are exempt from federal and provincial sales taxes.

Bermuda

Registration of a company in Bermuda

Bermuda is one of the leading offshore zones in the global market, that has been existing for a very long time. The islands have a rich, transparent and consistent infrastructure of the offshore benefits.

They provide a wide range of financial services, cooperate with a number of international offshore organizations and zones. The BMA (Bermuda Monetary Authority) regulates offshore companies activities .

This area can be called the capital of the offshore industry. An investor has unlimited access to international business relations with the most profitable conditions. Well organized offshore legislation is focused on the client needs.

The Acalista group company will help you to prepare all necessary documents with high quality, open bank accounts, register your company in Bermuda with all authorities and services. Our experts will competently represent your business interests on the international level.

Possible forms
of the offshore companies in Bermuda

There is only one possible type of the company in Bermuda – an Exempt Company. Exempt companies are allowed to conduct all kinds of legal activity:

  • banks (license);
  • insurance companies (license);
  • trust companies;
  • investment companies and funds;
  • split-account companies;
  • international IBC companies.

The Companies Act (1981, changed version – 2006) was approved for regulation of the offshore companies activities. The Regulation of the Government of the Bermuda has a prior right.

Companies in Bermuda
should not pay such taxesCompany registration rules
in BermudaFinancial reporting, accounting and auditing of a company
in Bermuda

لاn-residents receive the major tax benefits and transparency in doing business after registering in the islands. They are completely exempt from paying such types of taxes:

  • a الضريبة على الشركات;
  • an income tax;
  • a capital gains tax;
  • a real estate tax;
  • a gift, inheritance, transfer of property tax;
  • a dividend or interest tax.

There is no need to sign up the agreements on avoidance of the double taxation, as it is required in other offshore countries. Currency control is not carried out.

An office with registration in Bermuda and a full-time registered agent are compulsory required. Access to the information about directors to third parties can only be provided by a local court with an appropriate legal decision.

It is allowed to keep a company documents in any place. You can register an offshore company if the following conditions are met.

  • An enterprise can only be established by the non-residents of the country.
  • It is forbidden to arrogate the island's property.
  • Activities of the organization should not go against the national interests.
  • There is no possibility to accept the deposits.
  • The legislation prohibits buying an existing company by third parties in Bermuda.
  • The name of a company is submitted in English, using the word Limited, or Ltd. It is prohibited to use a name that does not indicate type of company activity or imply any connection with the state and municipality authorities.
  • Registration in the relevant registers starts after the submission of the documents and takes 3 days. If the Treasury of Bermuda is provided with full information about the beneficiaries and directors of the offshore, registration procedure will take just several hours.
  • It is necessary to register a legal address only in Bermuda.
  • The authorized capital is 12,000 dollars. It is allowed to use other currencies that can be easily converted to the equivalent. The capital must be distributed among the founders, but it is not necessary to pay it in full.
  • Only registered shares are permitted; it is prohibited to use the shares without declaring the owner. There is no issue of bearer shares, but the bearer may receive a debt obligations.
  • The company must have two directors – natural persons (legal entities are not allowed), one of them must be a citizen of Bermuda.
  • The meeting of shareholders is held annually. It can be done anywhere in the world. An unscheduled meeting may be initiated by the shareholders, owned the 10% of the shares. Directors may also hold meetings with compulsory keeping the minutes of it.
  • You can open more than one account in different banks. There are no restrictions on the number of accounts, banks and their location in other countries.
  • Fees and charges should be paid for registration.
  • If it is necessary, documents are notarized and apostilled.

All procedures of accounting, financial reporting and audit of an offshore company are carried out in a standard form once a year.

Peculiarities of the offshore companies
in Brazil

The registration procedure will take no more than two months. If you want to register a foreign company, you must have a prior permission and a confirmation document from the Executive Department.

The following conditions must be taken into account:

  • Brazilian legislation says that an enterprise must have at least two partners (the foreigners, legal entities, or Brazilian citizens);
  • before buying /establishing a company in Brazil, it is better to study the taxation of the existing Brazilian enterprises;
  • the company owns its financial capital, divided into parts (shares), that make a part of the profit of each partner in the company;
  • founders (responsible for quotas) are liable for obligations on an amount that is equal to the amount of the shares they own;
  • due to the above point, all founders have the ability and right to manage the company;
  • the director is not responsible for the company itself, but he can be prosecuted in the case of non-compliance with the law or exceeding powers by those who managed the company during a certain period of time;
  • It is necessary to hold the meetings at least 2 times a year to control the reports on financial results of previous months / years, and to check the competence of the owner / his appointment.
Required information for a company registration
in Brazilحول البلد
  • 1. Approval of the Articles of Association by the Board of founders, that provides the following information:
    • If a shareholder is an individual, detailed information about him is required (a full name, place of residence, nationality, occupation, marital status);
    • If a shareholder is a legal entity, detailed information about him is required (a name, legal address, period of existence of the company, sphere of activity, nationality).
  • 2. Signing of the amount of the authorized capital in Brazilian national currency and pointing the number of shares.
  • 3. Providing of all partner's shares, that form the share capital and ways of its payment.
  • 4. If partners have subsidiary liability, they should provide the details of this information.

Documents for a company registration:

  • certified copies of documents by a notary, confirming a legal entity or natural person;
  • documents, confirming the location of the company director (certified copies by a notary) and documents confirming their identity;
  • a copy of a document, confirming the payment of taxes by partners and the head of a company (it does not metter is it a legal entity or natural person);
  • a document (its certified copy) confirming the legal right to use real estate by a company in the place of a head office registration (lease agreement);
  • a document to the director for keeping /delegation of authority (issued by the foreign partners);
  • a document to the director for keeping /delegation of authority on behalf of a representative, in authorities such as the Central Bank of Brazil, the Ministry of Revenue, the Ministry of Labor (also issued by the foreign partners).

Brazil is the largest state in South America, both territorially and in terms of population, that is 205,737,996 inhabitants. The state of Brazil is a federation that includes a federal district, 23 states and 3 territories.

Brazil's economy has exceeded the development of other South American countries and has a special position in the global market. In 2004, Brazil stabilized the microeconomy by getting rid of debt and building up the foreign exchange reserves.

Since 2008, the state has been an external creditor with investment status without any debts, according to the statement of two rating agencies. Sure, there were economic downturns in the period from 2008 to 2010, but Brazil coped with all the difficulties and came back to the ranking of the most prosperous countries.

The state is one of the most profitable for the foreign investments due to the high interest rates and steady economic growth.

The Brazilian capital increasing caused the rapid growth of the local currency, that forced the heads of government to raise taxes on some foreign investment. Because of the rational approach to financial management, Brazil has become a steady country in the global economy.

Brazil is one of the most substantial countries in the developing world and has the largest economic potential among the Latin American countries.

Therefore, a lot of the investors choose Brazil for conducting their business and opening offshore companies in the state. It is especially beneficial to establish an enterprise for the coffee production and transportation to other countries.

Argentina

Registration of a company in Argentina

Argentina is still struggling to cope with the economic crisis that has been going on over the past decade. The state have a lot of work to do in order to revive the economy. Therefore, the government is trying to attract foreign investors.

Experts noted, that recently Argentina is on the right way: the Law of Tax Amnesty has been passed, control over the local currency has been removed, the dollar deficit has been eliminated, access to international money markets has been opened, and inflation has been reduced.

Benefits
for business

Well-developed natural resources make Argentina, that is a country with striking economic and natural contrasts, a state with high potential for business organizing. Among the foreign investors in the country, these areas are in great demand :

  • state infrastructure;
  • energetics;
  • tourism;
  • agriculture.

The internal market is not completely satisfied with the demand for consumer and capital goods, that opens up the prospects for creating a business structure. Real estate investments are also noteworthy.

with obtaining a shelf company

A business structure establishment in Argentina by foreign investors is possible in various organizational and legal forms. The most popular are:

  • A Corporation (S.A.)
  • A Branch of a foreign company.
  • A Limited Liability Company (SRL).

The Corporation is an open-type joint stock company, the minimum authorized capital is 12 thousand ARS. The quarter of the capital is paid at the time of a company registration, the rest – in two years. The minimum number of shareholders is 2. The organization is governed by a board of directors, most of them must be the Argentine citizens.

The Argentine branch of a foreign company is the second-most common form of business organizing for the foreign investors. It involves the translation of the main company's legalized documents into Spanish. The trustee must only be a resident of Argentina.

The Limited Liability Company is characterized by the absence of a set minimum share capital. A quarter of capital is paid by the shares owners at the time of a company registration, the rest – in two years. The shareholders cannot transfer their shares to the third parties. The minimum number of shareholders is 1, the maximum is 50. The director can be either a resident or non-resident of Argentina.

Requirements for registration
of an offshore company in Venezuela

Information
about jurisdiction

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines (also known as Saint Vincent) is an island country in the Lesser Antilles Islands, in the southern Caribbean, that lie at the southern end of the eastern border of the Caribbean Sea.

In the north, the country borders with Saint Lucia, in the east – with Barbados. The 389 square kilometers of the island are comprised of the main island of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines are in the north. They represent a chain of the small islands extending south towards Grenada.

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a densely populated country (over 300 people/km), and its capital and the main port is Kingstown. Saint Vincent provides the great advantages as an offshore jurisdiction due to its 0% tax rates for IBC companies, a steady infrastructure and has a positive reputation.

about using a company in Saint Vincent
  • Standard currency — USD
  • Standard authorized capital USD — 10 000
  • Minimum paid up capital — USD 1
  • Bearer shares — are authorized
  • Type of a company — a Limited Liability Company (LLC)
  • Timelines for a company registration — from 2 to 3 days
  • Legal regulation — The Companies Act of 2007.
  • The International Business Companies Act of 2008.
  • Common law legal system
  • Access to the company data in Registry — no public registry
  • Timezone — GMT -4
  • الضريبة على الشركات — no taxes of any kind
  • Requirement to appoint an auditor — No
  • Requirement of a report submitting — No
  • Access for accounts — No
  • Financial reporting requirement — No
  • A certified copy of a valid passport (or national ID)
  • A certified proof of an address — the utility bill (not over than 3 months) in English (or translation)
  • The original or certified copy of a bank reference letter (not over than 3 months) or an original of a bank statement (not over than 3 months).

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines does not have a double taxation treaty with any other country, therefore, the information about activities of an offshore company in Saint Vincent is not transferred to any other country. Moreover, there is no requirement for the filing of by-laws or for the disclosure of directors, shareholders and lawyers from an offshore financial authority or any other organization.

Registration of a company in Seychelles:
the main characteristics

There is no minimum share capital requirement

The minimum عدد المديرين is one (a non-resident and corporate director are allowed)

Confidentiality and Asset Protection: there are no requirements to submit the information about shareholders, beneficial owners or directors to any Seychelles government registry

Easy management: there are no requirement to file financial statements or an annual income statement for a company. Nevertheless, the registry agents require to keep records at the address where the company's documents are held.

  • dividends
  • interest

Instead of tax, there is a flat annual state duty, as well as an annual registered agent fee.

Offshore banking license

The offshore banking industry was almost taken down due to the introduction of FATCA, but now it is gaining popularity again.

International banking

The offshore banking activities were stopped from 2012 to 2015. The international banking functions are resumed now. Since 2012, the IRS in the United States has carried out a tight control for the offshore banks, closing small ones and imposing huge fines on large ones that could pay. The fines are still imposed on those who do not file the reports for the dollar accounts.

As we know, the US Congress enact the Foreign Account and Tax Compliance Act (FATCA). It requires all international banks that deal with the US dollar to report the US dollar accounts holders each year. In practice, this fact has turned the offshore bankers into unpaid IRS agents.

The project was delayed for years, and no one understood how it would be implemented. This uncertainty made it almost impossible to obtain the new offshore bank licenses and did not guarantee the applicant to open a correspondent account.

All existing banks were solving their current problems with AML and Compliance and no one had risked to start new projects.

The IRC proved the importance of the adopted law in 2016 and almost every bank in the world signed an agreement with the FATCA. Currently, new banks are faced with additional requirements, however, in practice, they all are possible to fulfill.

Tips for choosing the best jurisdiction
to obtain an offshore bank license:
  • If you are choosing a jurisdiction, you should figure out the reserve share capital amount. Some legislative acts require from $ 500,000 to $ 3 million for a license of a controlled bank and from $ 1 million to $ 7 million of a share capital for a small international bank. Jurisdictions such as Panama and Luxembourg will require $ 30 million for a general license.
  • Andorra and Luxembourg issue licenses for the large private banks.
  • The Cayman Islands prefer the investment and controlled banks (the jurisdiction is able to conduct transactions of the highest degree of reliability).
  • Vanuatu is a common jurisdiction for the European parent companies.
  • The Saint Kitts and Nevis and Dominica licenses connect the bank with the Eastern Caribbean region. It allows the bank to operate within the regional central bank. Registration of an offshore bank in Dominica will take only 1-2 months.
  • Belize has many advantages in the case of establishing a bank for making deposits, but there are high requirements for the authorized capital.
  • A lot of international banks are domiciled in Panama due to the low wage requirements, labor costs, executive visas and a world-wide reputation.
  • The Gambia – provide one of the easiest and fastest licensing procedures. Moreover, this jurisdiction is not at the black and white lists of the OECD and FATF, that allows companies to conduct business confidentially.
    If there is a need to take payments from the United States, we can register a bank in accordance with the FATCA requirements.
    Presently, it is one of the best jurisdictions for an offshore bank establishing.
Managed
bank
A bank with a controlled license can only run the activities of the person, indicated in the license. Therefore, every client / bank owner must be approved by the central bank.
The controlled banks are usually registered for:
the large family companies, groups of wealthy people or multinational corporations for extending credit around the world without tax liability.
Read more
International
Bank
Such licenses are often associated with the offshore industry. This type of license allows to conduct all types of banking business with clients outside the country that issues the license. For example, if you establish an international bank in Belize, you can offer services to anyone except residents of Belize.
General
bank
The general license allows you to do business with the local and international clients. First of all, the central banks aim to protect their citizens, so the capital requirements and regulation for general banks are more strict than for international banks.

Forex Broker License

The presence of a forex broker license for a forex broker is the main criterion in choosing a forex broker for traders. Licenses show which regulator controls the company quality and activities. What information can a trader extract?

For example, the license of the American futures regulator NFA controls one market, while the license for Antigua or Mauritius controls completely different market. There are a lot of regulators in the world that issue broker licenses for the forex activities with the important differences between them. Therefore, the trader should understand that the licenses issued by different regulatory authorities are not equal. That is why different forex licenses are rated differently in the forex broker rating. The most powerful forex broker licenses are awarded 100 points; licenses of the state bodies regulating the financial market are awarded 50 points; non-state self-proclaimed market regulators that have no influence on the forex brokers get 10 points.

A forex broker's license is necessary, but not the only argument in choosing a broker and opening an account with his company. For choosing a broker, it is necessary to consider the whole range of criteria for the forex brokers rating. This is what the professional traders do.

Electronic Money License in Estonia (EMI in Estonia)

An electronic money license in Estoniais obtained by submitting an application and a number of other documents to the EFSA – Estonian Financial Supervision Authority

EFSA – The Estonian Financial Control Commission issues licenses to the companies that are registered and carry out their main activities in Estonia. In the case of the securities or electronic money trading, it is necessary to obtain an investment company license or an electronic money institution license, accordingly.
The company must be registered as a Limited Liability Company in Estonia. In order to provide services, the share capital of the investment company must be at least 50,000 euros, while the share capital of the electronic money institution must be at least 350,000 euros.

Notably, the heads of any regulated company must comply with Due Diligence and KYC requirements, so, they must have the appropriate education and work experience (CVs, and even the diplomas must be provided on the request of EFSA), as well as have a perfect reputation (do not have a business bankruptcy case, a revocation of licenses, the criminal records, etc.).

The shareholders that purchase or have a substantial involvement in the company, must also have a good business reputation and no criminal record.

Read more
Documents for a license obtaining

In order to apply for a license from the EFSA, the following documents and information must be provided (some of them may relate to an existing company, but not to a re-registered legal entity):

  • Memorandum of Association;
  • Articles of Associations;
  • A confirmation of the paid-up share capital (if it is necessary);
  • A list of the shareholders (with the shares allocation);
  • An information about the shareholders, who own the holding (if they exist);
  • An information about the board of directors and company management (with the peculiarities);
  • An information about companies, where the participation of the applicant or his manager exceeds 20% (with the peculiarities);
  • An information about the auditor of the applicant and the person(s) that conducti an internal control (with the peculiarities);
  • A financial information (a balance sheet, an income and loss statement, annual reports);
  • Documents, confirming the amount of the net funds and the auditor's report;
  • If the qualifying holding is owned by a foreign person subject to financial control, a certificate issued by the supervisory authority of the state, that confirms that the foreign company has a valid license to operate and, according to the controlling body decision, its activities do not contradict the current legislation;
  • Business plan for three years;
  • Information about IT systems and equipment;
  • PCI DSS compliance as required;
  • Description of an organizational structure;
  • Company policies or procedures;
  • AML rules;
  • Rules for preservation of customer funds that were received for the electronic money issuing (if it is relevant);
  • Other internal rules that are relevant to all regulated entities or the specific services;
  • A document by which the applicant undertakes to pay the single fee, provided for in the Guarantee Fund Law (only for the proper investment company).

Electronic Money License in Great Britain

This article provides information about the Electronic Money Institution (EMI) — an electronic money license for a company, registered in the UK.

Depending on the turnover level, there are 2 options for registering an EMI license in the UK:
— a classic EMI, in this case the fee (duty) to the FCA will be £ 5,000;
— a small EMI (the monthly turnover should not exceed € 3,000,000; if the company do not conduct business — we will estimate according to the projections).

Timelines of registration

3 months (if the regulator — FCA, do not have any questions about the submitted application);
Up to 12 months (in case the FCA requests the additional documents).

It should be noted that the electronic money application is being implemented in general in the international regulation sphere. The companies with the electronic money can effectively offer a number of banking services and services for the client funds holding, as a rule, these services are provided online (that implies a lot of risks). Therefore, this well-organized application is just one step below the bank (if we consider this application as a financial instrument).

There are less requirements to the fund managers, stock brokers, depositories activities. For this reason, it is neccessary to know the features of the application (electronic money), all the key issues of the professional management and the attendant risks or problems and how to solve them asap.

First of all, conducting an EMI business requires the appropriate education and knowledge to manage and obtain an EMI license. It means that:
— The Senior Management must be experienced in organizing of such a type of company. This is an important fact for the FCA; persons with no experience in the field usually do not obtain a permission.
— The company must be managed from the UK.

Read more
The FCA singles out the following main points:

  • The company must have more UK resident directors (or an equal number) than foreign directors (their nationality does not matter).
  • The FCA affirms that the decisions of the Resident Director have a higher force; he may reject policies, strategies and decisions that are transferred from overseas if they do not comply with the UK law or regulation.
  • The meetings of the Board of Directors must be held in the UK.
  • Operational day-to-day decisions must be made in the UK and the office must be based in the same state.
  • A company may have a non-resident director on the Board of Directors of a UK company if the entire organization is completely based in the UK.
  • The CEO must be a resident and reside in the UK, and, as practice shows, the Compliance Manager as well.
  • The person responsible for a money-laundering control (that can also be a CEO if he has appropriate qualification) must be a resident of the UK.
  • If anyone moves to the UK with the intention of being a CEO, he should know the management rules, depending on the business model. Consequently, it may be necessary to appoint a local manager who has the competence to enforce the rules.
  • The services provided by any third party — as well as IT support services — must be provided on the basis of a concluded contract.

Secondly, there will be a necessity to open bank accounts that will allow your company to provide your services. The bank accounts must be under the name of your UK registered company. The accounts will be required to receive the customer's funds, until they are sent to the final recipient.

The accounts can be opened at any bank. Moreover, it should be a savings account. It is an important requirement of the FCA.

The main features that must be considered for submitting an application:

  • A business plan that describes the company activities, the proposed range of services and the corresponding control bodies in details
  • Provide the information about the possibility of an internal local control. It means the operations of the financial crime prevent, as well as observance of a complaint procedure, that will be carefully documented. There must be a Supreme Management Authority to deal with these complaints.
  • Keep the accounting records, including the payments verification to the bank accounts
  • Establish a business continuity and emergency recovery procedures

Electronic Money License in Latvia (EMI in Latvia)

This section provides information on the factors of an EMI license obtaining in Latvia — a license for electronic money in Latvia. The license is obtained by filing an application, as well as a number of other documents, to the EFSA — Estonian Financial Supervision Authority
This is the best option in terms of timelines / price / European license status.
Acalista group can offer such jurisdictions as Malta, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Great Britain, but all of them will be more expensive.

More details about the EMI license in Latvia

According to the Latvian legislation, if the amount of the issued e-money in the business plan does not exceed 2 million euros per year, the company can start its activities in Latvia after registration (without obtaining a full license).
In this case, information about the company, members of the board, a plan of commercial activities, documents on a money-laundering control and information on measures for the client money safety are submitted to the Financial and Capital Market Commission. There are no capital requirements.
If you are planning a larger turnover, you need to obtain a large (full) license. In this case, the initial capital of the company applying for a license must be at least 350,000 euros. The information and documents specified in the law should be prepared for a licence obtaining (we can provide more details on your request).

If you are planning to start an e-money company,
we suggest doing it in this order:
  • Make a registration of a company in Latvia.
    In this case, besides the company registration, it is necessary to submit to the Authority a smaller package of documents that:
    • firstly, will simplify the process of the necessary procedure to start an activity;
    • secondly, will allow to detect and settle all possible claims of the commission regarding the board members and the commercial plan (the basis of which will be later used to obtain a license) at the initial stage;
    • thirdly, will allow you to know better the specifics of the company's work in this jurisdiction
  • Please note that registered companies must operate only in the territory of Latvia. However, in the case of providing services on the Internet, it is difficult to identify the service territory. That is, if an agreement is concluded in Riga, Latvia, it can be insisted that the service is provided in Latvia (a lot of companies, registered in Latvia and working with foreign clients do that).
  • We recommend to go through the first registration stage, regardless whether you are ready for the whole licensing or not, as it allows the FKTK to get acquainted with your company beforehand and will simplify the further licensing procedure.

The price

  • a small license (aka registration) — 15,000 euros, timelines are 3-6 months
  • a full license (with the AC of 350,000 euros ) — 28,000 euros, timelines are 6-10 months

Both the small and full licenses are protected by PSD.
At present, the Acalista group has a successful experience in the licenses obtaining in Latvia.

EMI license in the Czech Republic

There are 2 types of licenses for electronic money institutions: EMI – an electronic money institution and SEMI – small electronic money issuer in the Czech Republic.

The specialists of the Acalista group have extensive experience in the preparation and execution of the required documents for obtaining EMI and SEMI licenses in the Czech Republic. Also, we maintain partnerships with the Czech National Bank — the institution that gives the licenses and controls the EMI in the Czech Republic.

You can find the basic information about the EMI and SEMI licenses, processing times, fees and charges below.

SEMI — Small electronic money issuer

Small electronic money issuer License: a processing time — approximately 1-2 months.

For a SEMI license obtaining, the following documents must be submitted to the Czech National Bank (all documents, except the integrity certificates, will be prepared by specialists of our company based on the information received from you):
  • An application for the company entering into the SEMI register;
  • A business license (an extract from the commercial register);
  • An integrity certificate issued by a foreign government for each chief officer;
  • A questionnaire regarding the assessment of each chief SEMI officer.
  • A business plan (a real business plan for the first 12 months of the SEMI activities, including the full financial statements, with detailed business plan comments, taking into account the average monthly limit of EUR 5,000,000 of issued electronic money);
  • A description of the way of individual payment services;
  • A chosen method of protecting the principals funds.

EMI — electronic money institution

Electronic money institution (EMI) license: a processing time — about 6 months.

The price of a license obtaining ranges from EUR 65,000 to EUR 90,000 plus VAT. The duty to the Czech National Bank is approximately 2000 Euro.

Gaming license in Malta

Over the past years Malta has become a leading and well-regulated European gaming jurisdiction, that accepts approximately 10% of the world's online gaming companies. The Government of Malta has carried out a complete review and consolidation of the gaming legislation, that has created the Malta Gaming Authority (MGA).

The processing time of an application for the iGaming license in the Maltese authorities takes on average 4 to 6 months. The procedure timelines depend just on the time it takes for the applicant to provide the necessary documentation and feedback.

General requirements for a license
obtaining

  • A Minimum share capital – $ 40,000 (can be formed after the MGA accepts a license issuing);
  • An Information about the officals: Anti-Money Laundering Officer; An Information security officer – should be freely available;
  • Segregated operating and gaming funds (a player account and company operating account independently);
  • A Regulatory data is becoming available to the authorities.

The Procedure

Applicants are required to complete the KYC and Due Diligence processes with the Malta Gaming Authority (“MGA”) before submitting an application. It is made in order to ensure that the applicant complies with the legal requirements of Malta, the license application is correctly developed and that all the essential elements are present and meet the procedure.

It usually helps to speed up the licensing process, since there would not be a missing or incomplete information that could slow down the whole procedure.

Application process

At this stage, the MGA checks:

  • Suitability of the applicant for gambling activity
    The MGA conducts due diligence analyze of all information about officials involved in the financing and management of the applicant's company. The authority also carries out the investigation on the company's integrity with other national and international regulatory and law enforcement agencies.
  • The company's business plan correctness.
    The MGA conducts a thorough financial analysis of the applicant's business plan. The business plan is expected to include a detailed course of action, as well as details related to marketing strategies, workforce planning and growth rates.
  • if a company meets the operational and statutory requirements to fulfill the legal obligations expected by the Maltese Legislation;
    The applicant is verifying for the technical background necessary for running a business. This process includes an analysis of the company founding documents, games, business processes related to conducting the remote games, rules, conditions and procedures for games, application and system architecture of gaming and control systems.
    The above components represent an audit of the application requirements and should be completed in 12-16 weeks.
  • If the candidate correctly implemented what had he used in the technical terms before the application was released.
    After all the steps have been successfully completed, the MGA will inform the candidate that the application has been confirmed and will invite the applicant to implement the technical environment for starting the activities.
    The applicant has 60 days to complete this operation. If the applicant does not finish the operation during this time, the application will be considered as a suspended and must be resubmitted.
    During these 60 days, the applicant may request an external systems audit (performed by an independent third party contracted with the MGA) at a fixed market price.
    The MGA allows minimal divergence from the application at this stage, but any significant changes to the gaming system will require re-submition of a new application.
    After the certification process has been successfully completed, the MGA issues a license for a period of five (5) years.
  • Verification of conformity
    Once the license is issued, an independent third party will contract with the MGA (at a fixed market price) to perform a series of compliance inspection on the licensees' operations.

Gaming license in Cyprus

A Gaming license in Cyprus. Cyprus is still a global trading center, where the control and regulation of Forex is carried out by the legislation. The Cyprus legislation provides the non-resident taxpayers with a 0% dividend tax.

The current Betting Law 2012 – Law 106 (1) / 2012 specifies the legal basis for the activities of betting operators and bookmakers. The National Bookmaker Authority (NBA) monitors the bookmakers activities in Cyprus – the online betting by gaming operators.

There are licenses of the following types:

class A – it regulates the bets on sports games. Bookmakers companies have a license of this class. All bets can be taken except for the horse racing. It doesn't work in the cyber world.

class B – it regulates the online activities of bookmakers. Bookmakers take the virtual reality sports betting. The exception is the slot machines, lotteries, online casinos.

Conditions for a license applying

The application procedure for a Class A or Class B license has a number of requirements.

  • The applicant is required to own the shares, registered in Cyprus.
  • It is necessary to have a company on the island whose main activity is betting. If the company is registered abroad, it is possible to create a branch of the foreign company in Cyprus or enter into a partnership with a Cyprus company.
    However, in this case, the applicant must have a share capital of at least EUR 500,000. The minimum capital requirement can be applied to both the Cypriot companies and foreign ones.
  • The guarantee term for deposits in a bank in Cyprus or any other state (the EU membership is compulsory) in the amount of EUR 550,000 is valid for six months after obtaining a license.
  • A high solvency for payments to players.
  • The organization must have a system for the bets recording.
  • It should protect players under the rules, according to the Betting Law, 2012.

Regardless of the class, all licenses are issued for a period of one or two years. In some cases, the period may be extended. In case of the rules violation, the NBA may revoke the license or suspend it under the Betting Law, 2012.

Additionally, the licensee must pay a fee of EUR 30,000 for one year and EUR 45,000 for two years.

Requirements for licensees

Applicants for a license are subject to additional requirements:

the payments for those who have received a class B license are made through a credit/debit card or through other types of electronic transfers (art. 54, the Betting Law, 2012);

During the Class B licensee are taking the electronic bets, he cannot make any transactions with cash (Art. 58 (1), the Betting Law, 2012);

The class B licensees are prohibited to take the bets if the funds on the company's account are insufficient to cover the player's bet;

The licensees of Class B are required to have a valid bank account that operates in Cyprus.

Tax
amount

The tax on the combined rate is calculated at 13%: a net profit – 10%, 3% – other taxes. 2% of the indicated 3% are allocated for the sports federations development and 1% – for the improvement of gambling programs (Article 71 of the Betting Law, 2012).

Software
requirements

The main backup server, that is located on the island, must be connected to the authority's computer equipment. Futhermore, the licensee company must have a special website address. The common platform for bets operations must meet the general criteria of the Betting Law, 2012.

Algorithm
of the licensing process

In order to obtain a class A, B license, you must:

register a company in Cyprus;
open a bank account;
fill out a license application;
draw up and submit a declaration on income and property;
prepare and submit the bank guarantees;
make a business plan for the neccessary business area.
