Лицензия онлайн букмекера на Кипре

В нынешнем году в юридическом области игорной веб-индустрии на европейском континенте протекают серьезные изменения. Одна из основополагающих тенденций на сегодняшний день – это введение, практически, каждым из наиболее значимых государств Европы лицензирования.

Большой спрос к этой сфере услуг дала постоянно увеличивающаяся популярность веббукмекеров и казино, которые основываются в Европейских и оффшорных юрисдикциях, в том числе в юрисдикциях Гибралтара, Мальты, Кюрасао, Коста-Рики.

Рейтинг Букмекеров

«Пальма первенства» в ограничении персональных торговых площадок, безусловно, принадлежит крупнейшим странам Европы, а именно Испании, Италии, Франции, Великобритании.

Эти страны, начиная с 2000-х годов, стали организовывать финансовые учреждения, которые регулируют игорную активность в сети и блокируют вход на торговые площадки для оффшоровых операторов.

Благодаря нишевой позиции игровой веб-индустрии, Европа перестала пытаться ее контролировать на национальном уровне. Вот почему в разработке персональной законодательной базы теперь имеются еще и аутсайдеры. Например, нидерландское государство только в июле 2016 года смогло сформировать нужный законопроект.

И он вряд ли будет в силе с 2018 года. Кипр – это еще одна страна, которая поздно присоединилась к данной тенденции. Это островная красивая страна, которая приняла закон про регулирование игровой деятельности почти десять лет назад – в 2012 году.

Но полноценно регулировать деятельность букмекерских компаний в сети Кипр, в силу многочисленных факторов, стал пробовать только с 2016 года.

Для этих задач была специально создана такая организация, как Нацкомиссия по играм (National Betting Authority). Последняя сказала, что принимает решения выдавать лицензии веб-букмекерам, начиная с третьего октября 2016 года.

Многие туристы из стран Содружества независимых государств, которые приезжали отдохнуть на Кипр, не понаслышке знают, что среди киприотов крайне популярны всевозможные игры.

Почти на каждой магистральной улочке крупного городка здесь будет хотя бы парочка игорных организаций – помещения для игры в кено или бинго, пункты приема ставок букмекерских контор.

Еще совсем недавно на Юге Кипра, где власти более ответственно и серьезно контролируют игорный бизнес, действовал законопроект, который запрещал играть в казино.

Поклонникам таких развлечений приходилось переходить разделительную полосу и ехать в северную часть страны, чтобы попасть в один из центров казино (здесь игорный бизнес под контролем администрации Турции). Но этот запрет не так давно был снят – чтобы привлечь вкладчиков для построения интегрированного курорта по казино.

Кипра интересуют финансово стабильные претенденты на лицензирование

Ясное дело, что крайне высокая популярность игорного бизнеса – это один из основополагающих моментов, из-за которых законодатели поставили крайне высокую планку вхождения на торговые площадки.

Поскольку обязанность и условие сформировать уставной капитал в размере пятисот тысяч евро, с подкреплением гарантией от банковских учреждений тоже на пятьсот тысяч евро, это совсем немало не только по объемам государства с населением меньше одного миллиона человек.

Это в пять-семь раз больше, чем на Мальте и в Великобритании – в лидирующих юрисдикциях.

Лицензированные платежные обязательства

Лицензированные платежные обязательства в тридцать тысяч евро за год за годовое лицензирование и сорок пять тысяч евро за двухгодовое лицензирование – не будет считаться низким. Прибавьте к этому еще и игорное налогообложение в тринадцать процентов от валовой игорной доходности.

Десять процентов от налоговой ставки, непосредственно, будет отправлено в казну. Остаток в три процента будет разделен между фондами, которые поддерживают спортфедерации и фонды, которые предотвращают и лечат игорную зависимость.

Регулятор, который поставил такие немалые условия, дает очень точный сигнал того, что Кипр интересуется исключительно финансово стабильными претендентами на лицензирование.

В число подобных претендентов, логично, что попадают и большие региональные операторы наземного букмекерства. Кроме того, выше обозначенные условия не составляют проблемы для глобальных лидерующих представителей в интернет-области.

Так получится ли у Кипра привлекать лидирующих операторов и лицензирование в государства, повторив прошлый удачный опыт в региональном объеме Мальты, другого средиземноморского активно развивающегося островновго государства?

Наша компания придерживается осторожного мнения на этот счет и имеет в этом плане оптимистические позиции.

С одной стороны, кроме большой цены, лицензирование еще ограничивается по линейке продукции. Создатели законодательных актов предпочитают «убрать» не только игровую линейку казино, но еще и такие типы спотставок, как спортставки на собачьи и лошадиные забеги, спрэд-бэттинг.

Кроме того, регуляторы выдвигают требование применять веб-ресурс конкретно с доменом — .com.cy

Но, кроме таких существенных недочетов, в противовес, можно назвать и суперважные благоприятствующие элементы. Согласно приходящего информационного потока, комиссия обладает широкими источниками для стремительного рассматрения четко выполненных заявок от профессиональных фирм.

Наиболее положительное оценивание – от пары недель до выдачи предварительного одобрения, что намного быстрее других юридических фирм.

Кроме того, НКБ не выдвигает требования о создании полноценной инфраструктуры серверов операторов на кипрском полуострове. На самом деле, хватит всего лишь и одного сервера, чтобы контролировать регуляторскую деятельность.

Но, возможно, самое основное достоинство, в этом случае, – это лингвистическая и геополитическая характеристика и особенность Кипра. В Республике Кипр законодательством признается три языка – греческий, турецкий и английский.

То есть, местное островное лицензирование – это, возможно, наиболее мудрое решение при избрании операторов, которые ориентируются на рынке близлежащих государств с соответствующими языками. С точки зрения репутации, кипрский остров обладает узнаваемыми характеристиками для аудиторий части восточной стороны Средиземного моря.

Кроме того, появление в странах Европы официально прошедших лицензии турецкоязычных веб-сайтов – это, возможно, еще один привлекательный момент для поклонников азартных игр из масштабной диаспоры Турции в странах западной Европы.

Безусловно, Кипр и не сможет обеспечивать сотнями лицензирование, как сейчас это делает Мальта.

Но, вероятно, изначально таких планов и не было. Наверное, основная задача запуска – это привлекать несколько сотен стабильных и профессиональных операторов для финансово счастливого запуска в регионе и в самом государстве.

Gaming license on the Isle of Man

The country's legislation sets out the requirements for a license obtaining in order to conduct gambling business, both regular organizations and online casinos, therefore obtaining a gaming license on the Isle of Man is a necessary procedure for carrying out the gambling activities.

Without a document in standart form, it will not be possible to run a business with a legal protected status, at any time the casino may be closed with the imposition of penalties. Currently, there are companies that provide license acquisition services.

Acalista group provides a full range of services for a license documenting, with the initial free consultation on the jurisdiction you are interested in.

General requirements for a license
obtaining

The supervisory authority GSC set on the requirements for a license registration:

  • a registration should be carried out only in the Isle of Man;
  • a founding memberships appoint two directors;
  • managers must be the residents of the Island;
  • opening of bank accounts in the island is compulsory.

For registering an application, the candidate pays the prescribed state fee during the consideration period. More about taxation:

  • an income tax is – 1.5%, provided that the gross income is not more than twenty thousand pounds sterling per year;
  • a turnover tax – 0.5%, if the annual profit is up to forty thousand pounds per year;
  • an income tax for over than forty thousand pounds sterling per year – 0.1%;
  • for bookmakers and sweepstakes – 15% of the profits.

Great Britain expects the owner of the enterprise to actually conduct business on the territory of the Isle of Man. The supervisory authority pays special attention to this factor, conducting inspections for providing the accurate data regularly.

A package of documents for registration

There are certain requirements for registration of licenses. Particularly, in the Isle of Man, you must provide:

copies of identity documents (passport) of the shareholders memberships;

a copy of the Articles of Association, taking into account the decision of the founding meeting on the assignment of a status, name to a company;

bank statements and other documents confirming the opening of an account, certified by a notary;

a business plan with graphs of income, investments, development paths;

providing the receipts for the state fees payment.

More information about the commission requirements you can find on the official GSC website.

Possibilities, provided
by a license

As was mentioned above, the Isle of Man has a regulatory body (the GSC) that issues a license and legalizes:

  • standard gambling organizations, halls, attractions;
  • online casinos, lotteries, virtual games, sports and other tournaments;
  • betting organizations activities (bookmakers, sweepstakes);
  • stock-exchange and financial rates.

Is it worth to get a gaming license in the Isle of Man?

Currently, the island is governed by the United Kingdom legislation. It is economically and politically stable country, providing loyal conditions for the formation of a casino, quick obtaining of the appropriate license.

The possibility of starting and step-by-step business development is provided, that is the registration of a general or sub-license. The sublicense provides an opportunity to work under the logo of the well-known, stable casinos.

As you can see, it is profitable to register and work in the gambling industry in the Isle of Man, since the UK is focused on loyal relationships that are aimed to develop the casinos, incl. online, where a small package of documents is enough to launch the network.

Overview

The most common legal entity in El Salvador is a Limited Liability Company (LLC).

It is important to note that the corporate income tax rate in El Salvador is 30% and is levied on the total income of a company.

However, a corporate income tax is based on a territorial principle and applies to the goods located in El Salvador, types of activities and capital investments, as well as any services provided in the country.

Although there are no restrictions on the citizenship or place of a shareholder residence, it is important to take into account that a special withholding tax rate of 25% applies for paying dividends, interest and royalties to a resident.

Required documents

In order to obtain a permit for a gambling business in El Salvador, you must provide the following documents:

  • a notarized copy of a valid passport (of each director or shareholder);
  • a notarized copy of the document confirming the residential address (for example, the utility bill for each director);
  • the Tax Identification Number (NIT) – for each shareholder (if any);
  • a bank statement (of each director);
  • two letters of recommendation from attorneys (for each director or shareholder);
  • a detailed resume with the date and signature of the applicant (for each director or shareholder);
  • the Diploma of Higher Education;
  • a certificate of the absence of a criminal record.

If the shareholder is a legal entity (company), it is necessary to submit:

  • a certified copy of the certificate of a company incorporation;
  • a list of shareholders;
  • a copy of the latest annual / financial report;
  • an Apostilled Certificate of Reliability (a Certificate of Good Standing).

As an additional precaution, the government authorities may require the originals of documents confirming the source of income.

Additional documents can be requested by the secretariat or local bank at any time to verify and confirm a specific information.

All documentation is provided in English. If the documents are not in English, they must be accompanied by a notarized translation.

Benefits:

Small amount of an initial capital.

Online gambling is not regulated in El Salvador.

The jurisdiction is not blacklisted.

How to start a gambling business in El Salvador

Requirements:

  • At least 1 director (a natural person, no restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).
  • At least 2 Shareholders (natural or legal person, no restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).

Taxation:

  • an income tax – 30%;
  • a tax "Pago a Cuenta" – 1.75% (is paid monthly as an advance payment of a corporate income tax);
  • a value added tax (VAT) – 13%;
  • a non-resident income tax:
  • Non-resident: 5% on dividends, 20% on interest, 20% on royalties.
  • Non-resident with no tax benefits: 25% on dividends, 25% on interest, 25% on royalties.

Accounting and auditing requirements

  • The company is obliged to conduct an external audit.
  • An annual financial statements to the Chamber of Commerce.
  • An annual tax audit depends on the company's income.
  • A local office is required.
  • A registered representative is required. The company must appoint a local administrator who will represent its interests in the tax office of El Salvador, it can be a resident or a foreigner residing in El Salvador.
  • A secretary is required.

Company name

  • The letters – the Latin alphabet.
  • It must contain the words "Limited Liability Company" or the abbreviation "LLC".
  • Do not use the names of the state authorities and local self-government bodies in the name.
  • The name of the company should not go against the moral norms, and also should not be misleading regarding the organizational and legal form, area of activity.
  • Do not use the names of existing companies or identical to them.
  • The Registrar can reject any name that is considered as inappropriate or contrary to the public interest.
The Procedure

In order to obtain a permission for online gamble business in El Salvador, the applicant should:

  • make a request for a company name reservation;
  • apply to the Ministry of Finance for obtaining the Tax Identification Number (NIT) and The Value Added Tax Identification Number (IVA);
  • make a registration at the city hall;
  • make a registration in the Main Department of Statistics and Population Census;
  • make a registration in the Chamber of Commerce;
  • open a bank account.

Gaming license in Denmark

Despite the fact that by the European standards, Denmark is a fairly small country (a total area is 43 thousand km2 , population is about 6 million), it shows excellent results in economic and social development, that is prooved by the 4th place in the world, according to the human development index.

It includes a high standard of living (the average salary is 30% higher than the EU average), as well as there is a wide range of activities out the working hours. It is possible because of the 37.5 hour workweek.

Denmark is one of the happiest countries in the world according to the special research conducted in 2016. In 2015, an organization of the economic development also said that Denmark has the least gap between the two extremes of human well-being.

Despite the general liberalization of Danish legislation, the position of the gambling business is rather doubtful, since the registration of a gambling business in Denmark has a controversial origin. But, as you know, the general liberal program does not include direct regulation of the service market by the relevant government agencies.

Therefore, the issue of a gambling business organization in Denmark requires a detailed analysis.

History of a gambling business legalization in Denmark

The history of illegal gambling in Denmark is quite long. In the post-war period, it was easier to monopolize all possible types of gambling than to fight them. In 1948, the Danske Spil company was created for this. This brand has existed to that end.

Though, the slot machines was allowed in the entertainment places, the game was provided only for the conditional monetary units.

Later, at the turn of the 70s and 80s of the twentieth century, there was a large number of clandestine gambling organizations, that were available only for trusted people. Such places were usually located in bars.

An interesting fact is that in the clandestine gambling places the game was for matches or pieces of paper, that were later exchanged for cash, according to the specially established pay tables.

After the legislation had taken another step towards liberalizing gambling in 1990, the demand for clandestine organizations was redused.

The amendments to the current legislation provided opportunities for the admission of the casino operators from a number of European countries (Germany, Austria, the Netherlands). However, the activities in Denmark need obtaining a license and compliance with the extremely strict requirements.

One of the regulations that the requirements included, was the creation a joint venture with a resident from Denmark by a foreign agent. Due to this fact, the gambling organizations have started to placed in the hotels, that operate as partners.

With the Internet development, a large number of online casinos have appeared with the full tools in the form of games and bets. As this business sector began to grow rapidly, the government faced the need for legislative regulation of it.

One of the first steps was the ban on the foreign companies activities in territories controlled by the Danish jurisdiction in 2003. Online casino operators were quite often registered in countries with a freer market in terms of government control.

Therefore, the Danish banks were forced to refuse servicing the credit cards, that were used to pay for services in the online gambling organizations.

When such initiatives were appeared in Danish legislation, it has caused a negative reaction from the European Union. The disagreement between local requirements and European institutions has been worsened since Denmark ratified the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union in 2008.

For the status quo resumption, there were made changes in the existing legislation on the gambling business in 2010. The applying started in 2012.

One of the initiatives was the Danske Spil's legal deprivation of gambling monopolization and de facto the access of the foreign agents to the local market. The state retained the right for the state lottery, bingo game, lottery scratch cards, bets on horse, dog and pigeon races.

The private companies have got the right to engage in such gambling activities as slots, betting and online casinos.

However, in 2014, a number of amendments were adopted. It has significantly tightened the legislation against the foreign operators. First of all, both operators and distributors of casino software, according to the new amendments, were obliged to be tested and licensed in Denmark.

The online casinos owners from abroad were obliged to pay tax in the amount of 20% of income to the Danish budget.

Types of gambling that are subject to be licensed

According to the information of 2013, the most popular and profitable types of gambling activity are:

lotteries – $ 457 million;

slot machines – $ 240 million;

betting – $ 205 million;

online casino – $ 146 million;

regular casinos – $ 49.4 million;

horse racing – $ 19.9 million.

The total amount of income from the types of gambling business, regulated by the state law, is $ 1.12 billion as of 2013.

Among other types of gaming activities is a poker. According to the Danish legislation, the sports poker cannot be classified as gambling, and thereby, the organization does not need a license.

The poker, especially an online game, has been popular in Denmark for quite a long time. This popularity is caused by the success of Copenhagen resident Gustav Hansen, a professional poker player. The amount of a prize money he had gotten for over 10 years of playing was almost $ 10 million.

The popularity of poker in Denmark is also a reason why this small country is consistently ranked 25th in the global WSOP rankings. Unfortunately, the information on an annual income for a poker organization is unclear.

Legal aspects
of running a gambling business in Denmark

A commercial gaming activities will not be legal without obtaining an official permit from the appropriate authority. The Ministry of Justice provides the licensing of gambling organizarions.

The concept of gambling debt is equated to a “duty of honor” in public etiquette, because the legal payment of gambling debts is not provided for the unlicensed games.

According to the legislative regulations, a specialized Office of Gambling Control has been providing licenses for individuals and legal entities who want to conduct commercial gambling activities since 2012. The licensing terms are following:

  • providing a detailed justification for conducting the commercial activities in this area from the benefit aspect;
  • the applicant has no criminal record and has reached the age of 21;
  • confirmation of the clear business reputation of the company;
  • payment of the duty, that is $ 37,000 for online casinos and bookmakers, and the duty for both types of commercial organizations will be $ 52,000, it can be paid in local currency;
  • the duty for the license itself can vary from $ 7,400 to $ 220,000.

Criminal liability for the gaming activities organizing in a public place can be in the form of a fine or one year in prison.

Criminal liability for providing premises for the unlicensed gambling is in a form of a fine or imprisonment for up to six months, and direct participation in gambling is punished by fines.

Organization of lotteries

Initially, the Danske Spil organization, when it was founded in 1948, was called Dansk Tipstjeneste. The organization was founded by the Danish government, the Olympic Committee and the Sports Federation. About 80% of the sponsorship amount was provided by the government.

Two companies were created in 2012, based on this organization. The first one, The Danske Lotteri Spil, covers the lottery segment (Lotto, Keno, Eurojackpot), Bingo lotto, accepts bets on Dantoto equestrian sports and organizes Quick scratch cards. The second, the Danske Licens Spil, is engaged in the activities of bookmakers and online gambling.

There is also another state lottery called Klasseloteriet. Before the active development of the Internet, tickets were distributed through a certified dealer network. The slogan, that has been constant for many years, says “Denmark's Millions Lottery”..

It performs two functions at once – to emphasize the amount of the potential winnings and the extencive participation in the lottery. Each ticket contains a unique numerical combination, and the price of each lottery ticket directly depends on the potential winnings.

Online casinos

Before the Danish online casino legislation was amended in 2010, there had been about 400 online casinos in the Kingdom, most of which were created in collaboration with the Danish residents.

Due to the fact that the new legislation provided the licensing, a large number of operators decided to legalize their commercial activities. During the first year of the new legislation, only 25 licenses were issued by the Danish Gambling Authority.

The companies such as the 888, the Ladbrokes and the Bwin were among the first to legalize their sites. At the same time, about 57 sites were blacklisted as unlicensed.

There are currently about 210 online casinos in Denmark. Most of them have two languages in the interface – Danish and English, and currencies they use are dollars, euros and Danish kroner. Such sites as Dansk777 Casino, Casino Cruise and Bet365 use the toolkit that matches the casino exactly.

Sites like All Slots Mobile, 32Red Mobile, and Golden Riviera specialize in mobile gambling content. Services such as Zezam, Spillenjørnet, Live Casino and Casino are officially supported by the Danske Licens Spil.

Betting

The bets are mostly accepted on various sports events in the gambling industry. The most popular events are soccer competitions that are broadcasted on the Danish television, i.e. the English Premier League and the National Football League.

Because of the golf success of Thomas Bjorn, a resident of Silkeborg, the sport calls attention by the Danes too and the bets are accepted on it. Also, such sports as handball and badminton are popular with bookmakers. Recently, there has also been an increase in the number of bets on cycling.

In many ways, such a high popularity of this sports competition is caused by Denmark's proposal to host the first stage of the Tour de France on its territory.

A smaller, but no less significant, segment in the betting industry is the financial and political events – an integral part of the betting industry.

The TopBetta, the Fanaments and the Star Fantasy League Operators have a clear focus on the fantasy sports betting, but other operators, such as the Bet365, also have these items in the sportsbook list.

Notably, that the Bet365 and the BetEnt are affiliated representations of world-class bookmakers, but the Danske Licens Spil is the leader among operators.

Land-based casino organization

This type of casino effected to the weakening of the Danske Spil state monopoly. Nowadays, the stationary casinos are operating in Copenhagen, Aalborg, Helsingor, Aarhus, Vejle and Odense.

Moreover, there is the Pearl Seaways ferry that runs between Oslo and Copenhagen, that is also provided by a gambling organization. The Copenhagen casino are the first among the largest gambling organizations in Northern Europe. The types of gambling in land-based casinos are represented by slots, poker, blackjack, roulette, baccarat and punto banco.

The regulation of this type of casino is carried out as follows:

  • the minimum entrance fee should be about $ 14;
  • the casino should work no more than 14 hours a day;
  • the clients must have the membership cards;
  • the minors cannot join games;
  • the clients identification.

There is also a list of rules, controlled by the police, about using the recording techniques and the clients' appearance.

Horseback Riding

The horse racing is a well-developed sport in Denmark. There are 9 racetracks, the largest ones are located in Klumpenborg, Bornholm and Billund. The bets are accepted both beforehand or in-play. The official operator of the equestrian sports betting is the state-owned company – the Danske Lotteti Spil.

Slot machine industry

If we look at the data for Denmark in 2012 (that is, even before the amendments to the legislation were adapted) – they are as follows:

  • classic slot machines – 26 thousand;
  • arcade slot machines – 3.3 thousand.

An average annual income from using the slot machines was about $ 266 million in 2012. This index looks quite impressive, compared with an annual income from online games and betting in general. The last one was $ 296 million in the same year.

State influence
on the gambling services market

Despite the fact that the state monopoly on gambling was officially annuled in 2010, many of the control mechanisms and regulatory functions are still running within the state jurisdiction:

  • A licenses obtaining for gambling business. Both private and public companies are required to get a license. Moreover, even the main state operator – the Danske Spil is required to be licensed annually, while the list of games for applicants is strictly regulated.
  • Regulation of the advertising campaigns. The operator is allowed to advertise its products only after obtaining a license, and should not use the services of third parties. It is forbidden to involve celebrities in the advertising campaigns. They must also provide information in such a way that a potential consumer can adequately assess their chances of winning.
  • Control over the financial activities. During the licensing process, a primary control is carried out, however, additional checks can be conducted at any time. The taxes on gambling business are quite high in Denmark. There are two types of taxes – an income tax for operators (45% for the first 4 million Danish kroner, then 75% is paid, for online establishments – 20%) and a الضريبة على الشركات, that is 25% of the rest.
  • Distribution of funds received as a result of state licensing and taxation. Funds are often refferred to sports and cultural programs.

If we take into account the breacking of the state monopoly on all types of gambling business, a detailed study of statistics shows that organizations, controlled by state bodies, still have been having a greater sphere of influence on the gambling services market in comparison with the private companies.

The segment of the market, directly or indirectly controlled by the state, is 62%.

Register
of the self-excluded players

In order to improve the efficiency of the fight against gambling addiction, the Danish Gambling Authority has created the ROFUS – a special register of self-excluded players. This register aims to protect Danish citizens from gambling, while registration is carried out on a voluntary basis.

Once a citizen is registered, he cannot join in both betting and online games that have been licensed. There are two forms – permanent exemption and temporary.

A temporary exclusion gives a participant the opportunity to choose by himself the period during which he will not be able to play. After this period the opportunity will be renewed automatically.

The permanent exclusion has a minimum period of one year. When this period is over, an application for deletion from the register may be submitted to the appropriate authority.

Prospects
of the gambling business in Denmark

As of 2016, the amount of income from all types of the government-regulated gambling is about $ 1.33 billion. If we calculate this amount in relation to the entire population of Denmark over 18 years old, it will amount to $ 295 or 2000 Danish crowns.

After the liberalization of legislation in 2010, the gaming services market shows rather slow, but stable increase. If the legislation is not changed in the future, such trends will continue.

However, the latest amendments to the legislation in 2014 caused outrage of the state's European partners, so the chance of the new amendments to the legislation is still possible, and all owners of gambling organizations know it.

Banking license in Vanuatu

Banking license in Vanuatu. Financial flows, lending activities, the complex of monetary and banking operations – it is profitable for the banking development. Opening a bank in Europe is a rather difficult procedure. An alternative of a banking license obtaining is the Pacific Republic of Vanuatu in Melanesia.

The Security License of Vanuatu bring benefits for business in the financial sphere, it covers Forex activities. This jurisdiction is profitable for the offshore company establishment, opening a foreign bank account for an external economic activity.

The main principles of the jurisdiction are transparency and simplicity of the offshore activities in accordance with international standards.

The activities of banks are regulated by the Financial Institutions Act of November 2, 1999. According to the legislation, a bank is regulated as a party who:

coordinates the processes of the bonds, certificates, securities flows with individuals or legal entities, using the income from these operations (totally or part of it) for crediting and investment;
carries out the financial investments accepting from individuals with withdrawal on-demand or upon expiration of the term.

Who is responsible for the decision
to issue a license for a bank opening?

The decision on a license assignment to a particular bank should be made by the Minister. All documents for a license registration are prepared and submitted by a licensing agent. An ordinary person who comes to Vanuatu will not be able to get a license by himself. He needs a help of a licensing agent who organizes the transfer of documents.

What is required to apply for a banking license
in the Republic of Vanuatu?

In order to apply for a banking license, you must:

  • provide the confirmation of an authorized capital in the amount from 500 thousand US dollars for opening a financial organization;
  • have a physical office, registered in the territory of the Republic;
  • draw up a detailed business plan, with the defining of goals and ways to achieve them; it should be prepared by a professional financier;
  • give the copies of identity documents of bank beneficiaries, that are carefully checked by the state authorities of Vanuatu;
  • set up a professional team of employees with a banking education; specialists of our company can help to find a solution in this case;
  • provide an annual accounting support, that costs 16 thousand US dollars;
  • pay for the license once a year;
  • organize and adopt an accounting for the financial flows, according to the ministerial rules and accounting requirements.

After the entire set of documents is prepared, you should make a request to the Reserve Bank of the Republic of Vanuatu. In order to have it done, you should:

  • pay all state fees;
  • give a written application for permission to grant a license to the organization, registered in the island;
  • provide all valid and truthful information.

An application is reviewed within four months.

Commission Fees –
Vanuatu Banking License

The price of a banking structure establishment in Vanuatu includes a state duty, the commission fees for the licensee agent services, an office renting in the territory of Republic, the staff employment, etc. All calculations can be made at a privat consultation.

The duty is levied annually for payment of the founding company. The bank cannot be registered without such company.

Why do License Applications get rejected?

The Reserve Bank may refuse the licensee if:

  • the organization does not legally exist;
  • it is not profitable to the Republic economy;
  • the financial flows for the authorized capital confirmation are contrary to the legislation, their background is criminal or unclear;
  • the identity documents of the shareholders or the Founding Director are unsatisfactory;
  • an internal control, an accounting, a risk regulation of a legal entity do not meet the requirements of the Minister;
  • the operation of the owning bank or the admitted joint stock company is unacceptable;
  • the amount of payments has not been totally fulfilled, as the legislation of Vanuatu requires, for the bank it is VT 200 million, for the creditor company – 100 million VT.
An action course of a license
obtaining procedure for the banking sector

Firstly, in order to start the license obtaining process, you should seek an advice of the specialists, experienced in this area.

Secondly, the initial formation of the organization and the cost of the license on the island territory will be 150 thousand EUR.

Thirdly, it is necessary to provide a set of official documents and establish a company in the Republic of Vanuatu.

The founders or beneficiaries provide:

  • The copies of the foreign passports certified by a notary;
  • A proof of registration – it can be a notarized copy of the utility bill, an extract from the bank about the account existence, indicating the owner's address, the validity of this document is at most 3 months at the time of submission the documents for a license;
  • A resume in English;
  • A Police Clearance Certificate;
  • A business plan;
  • An application for a banking license purchasing.

Investment banking license in Labuan

Investment banking license in Labuan. Labuan borders with Malaysia on the east, the South China Sea on the south and the Brunei Bay on the north. It is a part of the federal territory of Malaysia and consists of one large and six small islands.

Labuan Investment Banking Business under the Labuan Financial Services Securities Act, 2010 (LFSSA) means:

Providing with the credit funds;
Support with the consulting services on corporate and investment issues or making an investment on behalf of any person;
Conducting the foreign currency transactions, the interest rate swaps, the transactions with derivatives or financial derivatives or any other similar risks management activities;
Labuan Islamic Investment Banking Business;
Management of funds, with the permission of the Minister, can be in any currency other than the Malaysian currency.
Labuan Investment Banks are not allowed to accept deposits.

In accordance with the LFSSA regulations and the Foreign Exchange Control Act, 1953 (ECM), a licensed investment bank Labuan are able to transact in the Malaysian ringgit and with Malaysian residents.

Eligibility
for the Labuan License

Labuan Investment Bank can be established as a branch or subsidiary and registered under the Labuan Companies Act, 1990. The application can be accepted from:

  • An investment bank or investment banking group licensed by the regulatory authority at the country of origin;
  • A licensed bank or designated financial institution or financial service supplier, controlled by a competent regulatory authority;
  • Any licensed institution under the BAFIA with prior permission from the Bank Negara Malaysia; and also
  • Corporations with the requisite financial experience and expertise, with good results, with a track record of at least 3 years and regulated by an authority in their countries.
Approval Requirements –
Labuan Investment Banking License

The applicant company submits an application from the head office / parent company and assumes all responsibility caused by the activities of its branch or subsidiary in Labuan;

  • The applicant company must submit a business plan for the first 3 years of work;
  • The applicant company must also submit the verified annual reports for 3 pre-app years;
  • The request, where it is relevant, must be verified by a letter confirmation from the regulatory authority;
  • The controller or director/CEO of the applicant company must meet the requirements.

The appointment of the subsidiary's board of directors also requires a prior approval from the Labuan FSA.

Timelines –
Labuan Investment Banking License

The term, excluding the time for opening a bank account – 6-12 months + delivery time, depending on the provided documents.

The minimum paid capital is 10 million RMB (or equivalent in any other currency).
Opening a bank account – 3-4 weeks (depending on the client's documents, type of activity and the validity period of the bank reference letter).

Allowed currencies are any other but the Malaysian ringgit.

Company structure – Investment banking license in Labuan

The founders – from 1 shareholder (there can only be the legal entities, without restrictions on citizenship or place of residence)

The directors – at least 2 directors (they can only be the natural persons, without restrictions on citizenship or place of residence).

After a license is obtained, you must establish a local office (without requirements for its size or location), have at least 3 local employees and a local phone number. Physical presence of at least 1 Operations Manager, 1 Compliance Officer, and 1 Accountant.

and requirements

Forex Broker License in Bulgaria

Bulgaria is an excellent choice for the forex brokers who want to operate legally and be properly regulated. As Bulgaria is a member of the European Union, a company that has received a forex broker license in this country, having carried out the license certification procedure, allows a forex broker to work throughout the EU.

MOREOVER, BULGARIA HAS:

  • Very favorable الضريبة على الشركات, that is 10% only;
  • Acceptable registration requirements;
  • Reasonable license fees;
  • Access to a highly skilled workers with one of the lowest salaries in Europe.

Bulgaria is not only a part of the European Union, but also an active member of the financial instruments market MiFID Commission, that is responsible for development of the financial sector standards throughout the European Union.

While the regulations differ across the various European jurisdictions, the MiFID coordinates regulations of the different EU states. It is implemented by providing a certification for the forex brokers, that allows them to conduct business in any EU state, as it was authorized by their state regulator.

What is the FSC?

The FSC is the Bulgarian Financial Supervision Commission, that is also the country's financial regulator, responsible for issuing the forex licenses, as well as:

  • checking of documentation provided by companies as a part of their applications for licenses and permits;
  • making changes to the license status in case of non-compliance with the regulator requirements;
  • ensuring that organizations that are licensed by the FSC follow all the regulator's rules that they are required to comply with.

The FSC also sets out rules for a forex broker that appeals to:

  • Requirements for the capital amount and company structure;
  • The source of the funds that forms the authorized capital of the company;
  • Relations between individuals and legal entities according to the legal norms;
  • Requirements for the members of governing and supervisory bodies;
The FSC control

The Financial Supervision Commission checks activities of the forex broker company both inside and outside of any market participant's activities.

The aim of the FSC monitoring activities is to ensure that any legal infringement is prevented.

It includes protecting the investors interests by ensuring that the forex broker complies with all legal requirements, as well as the financial stability of forex brokers is guaranteed, including that the information they provide to consumers is accurate and reliable.

General requirements for obtaining the FSC forex broker license in Bulgaria

The forex companies desiring to operate and obtain a license in Bulgaria must be registered as an investment intermediary in the country and obtain a license from the Financial Supervision Commission of Bulgaria.

Types of licenses granted by the Financial Supervision Commission

There are two types of licenses granted by the FSC that are useful for the Forex brokers. Subject to the type of activity that a forex broker will conduct, he must obtain either a brokerage license — STP or a full license — Market Maker.

Broker license STP — a forex broker license in Bulgaria

This type of license allows the investment intermediary to hold traders' funds and securities and provide any of the following services:

  • Acceptance and transmission of orders in relation to one or several financial instruments, including the intermediary services for concluding transactions in financial instruments;
  • Providing clients with the investment advice;
  • Execution of orders on behalf of the clients;
  • Portfolio management.

The minimum share capital for this license is BGN 250,000 (approx. EUR 125,000)

A Forex broker must:
  • hire two directors who have relevant higher education in finance or economics;
  • have a successful work experience in the financial sector;
  • the directors must have no criminal record;
  • the directors cannot relate to each other (be relatives or joined to other companies);
  • the directors can be foreigners;
  • The company must have the necessary software, hardware and technology in order to provide services to customers, or otherwise engage third-party suppliers;
  • The company should provide FSC with a detailed business plan that include expected revenues for 3 years, etc.;
  • A forex broker must have a physical office in Bulgaria in order to operate in Bulgaria.

The process of a license obtaining with the FSC takes about 4 months from the date of full submission of an application.

Brokerage STP
license
This type of license gives an investment intermediary the ability to hold traders' funds and securities and provide any of the following services:
  • Acceptance and transmission of orders in relation to one or several financial instruments, including the intermediary services for concluding transactions in financial instruments;
  • Providing clients with the investment advice;
  • Execution of orders on behalf of the clients;
  • Portfolio management.
The minimum share capital for this license is BGN 250,000 (approx. EUR 125,000)
A full License —
Market Maker License
This type of license provides an investment intermediary with the ability to trade and make decisions on its own behalf. The minimum capital requirements for this license are BGN 1,500,000 (approx. EUR 750,000).

Forex Broker License in Hong Kong

Regulation of the forex broker companies in Hong Kong

The Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong, aka the Hong Kong SFC, is the regulatory body responsible for all administrative, regulatory and supervisory practices of Hong Kong broker companies. In order to obtain a Hong Kong forex broker license, all applications must be submitted to the SFC.

Applying for a Forex Broker License with the SFC Hong Kong

You must register a Hong Kong company with forex broker activities in order to obtain a Hong Kong forex broker license. An application for a license involves the filing of the documents such as the Memorandum and Articles of Association, as well as the company's management for internal and external procedures, company policies. You should also provide the results of the Due Diligence and KYC procedures.

The applying procedure for obtaining a forex broker license in Hong Kong is long and complicated. For a positive result of a license obtaining, it is necessary to follow all established procedures and provide all documents requested by the Hong Kong SFC.

Types of licenses in Hong Kong

There are the necessary information below about obtaining a Hong Kong Securities and Finance Ordinance (SFO) license. The following activities are considered as the regulated activities that require licensing in HK:

  • Type 1 – Dealing in Securities
  • Type 2 – Dealing in Futures Contracts
  • Type 3 – Leveraged Foreign Exchange Trading
  • Type 4 – Advising on Securities
  • Type 5 – Advising on Futures Contracts
  • Type 6 – Advising on Corporate Finance
  • Type 7 – Providing Automated Trading Services
  • Type 8 – Securities Margin Financing
  • Type 9 – Asset Management
Share capital requirements for a Hong Kong forex broker license obtaining

Based on the fact that the forex broker activity will be limited only to the foreign exchange trading (type 3), such a company must keep a paid-in share capital and Liquid capital of at least HKD 5,000,000 and Liquid capital must be no less than HKD 3,000,000.

“Liquid capital” is defined as “the sum, the part of the liquid assets of which exceeds the amount of its liabilities”.

Requirements to staff for obtaining a Hong Kong Forex Broker License

In the case of applying for a Hong Kong forex broker license, at least two responsible officials of the applicant must be engaged in regulated activities, the company is licensed for (activity of a forex broker is regulated only by a license of type 3, thus only 2 responsible officials (RO) are required.

One of the responsible officials must operate as the chief executive of the company. Both responsible officials must have a representative license for the regulated activity.

The regulator will check whether the proposed specialists have appropriate abilities, skills, knowledge and experience to manage and control the company's business effectively in relation to regulated activities.

Costs of a license for a forex broker obtaining in Hong Kong

As for a forex broker license in this jurisdiction, the Acalista group charges fees at hourly rates. The type 3 license application is assumed and include the following steps:

  • Preparation, submission, modification of the license forms (for a company and for the responsible officials – RO),
  • Drawing up a business plan,
  • Preparation of agreements,
  • Preparation of materials for the AML and KYC procedures,
  • Preparation of other materials at the regulator request,
  • Holding meetings, conferences and communication sessions with clients,
  • Answering queries and communicating with the SFC
  • Registration of a company in Hong Kong

Forex Broker License in Estonia

If a forex broker has a forex broker license, it is the main criterion in choosing a forex broker by traders. Licenses show which regulator controls the company quality and activities.

Estonia is an excellent jurisdiction for a forex license obtaining due to the fact that Estonia is a respected jurisdiction in the EU. Also, Estonian state authorities are loyal to this type of activity if all legal procedures and requirements are met.

According to the Estonian legislation, the forex broker services are classified as “investment services”. Legal entities operating as a Forex broker need to obtain a special EFSA license, that is regulated by the Estonian Securities Market Act, as well as within the EU — MIFID — the EU Markets in Financial Instruments Directive.

EFSA license — a forex broker license in Estonia

The EFSA is the licensing authority for legal entities that are registered in Estonia, have a registered office in Estonia and are operating in Estonia.

The activity that is subject to licensing is the securities trading, and there may also be other services that are related to securities; Forex broker services, as well as electronic money services, require an investment license. In order to obtain an EFSA license, you do not need to get a FIU certificate.

Based on the Estonian Securities Market Act, the term “securities” includes:
  • shares or other equivalent rights that are in turnover;
  • IOUs, convertible securities, other promissory notes that have been issued and are in the turnover and are not a money market instrument;
  • rights to purchase the securities;
  • a share in an investment fund;
  • a money market instrument;
  • a derivative security or derivative contract;
  • a turnover certificate of a security depositing.

In order to comply with a license, a legal entity must be registered as a Limited Liability Company in Estonia.

The directors of any regulated legal entity must meet certain criteria – have a proper higher education and work experience in this area (a CV, diplomas of education should be provided), as well as a good reputation (no bankruptcy cases, revocation of licenses, convictions, etc.).

Founders, who take a significant part in the company management, must also have an appropriate business reputation and have no criminal offenses. Also, the EFSA will check the financial situation of shareholders.

General organizational requirements for staff

The hired staff should have enough skills, experience and competence to fulfil the professional or official duties;

According to the law, an appropriate official is:

  • a forex company manager and forex agent;
  • a forex agent manager of a forex company;
  • an officer of a forex company and its forex agent who is involved in the provision of investment or ancillary services or carrying out the investment transactions;
  • an individual who is involved in providing of services to a forex company that are under the control of a forex company or its forex agent;
  • an individual who provides the services to a forex company or its forex agent under agreement of transfering the operations.

According to the Estonian Securities Market Act, there are some requirements for the authorized capital for a forex broker license obtaining:

1) 50,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • taking and transmission of orders related to securities;
  • the orders implementation, related to securities, on behalf of the client;

2) 125,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • portfolio management;
  • organization of securities offer or issue;
  • safekeeping and management of securities for the client, as well as related activities, including the securities transfer and pledge and other actions related to the encumbrance of clients' securities and transfers for execution;

3) 730,000 euros if the legal entity provides such services:

  • transactions with securities at own expense;
  • securities ensuring or guaranteeing of its offer, issue or sale;

In each specific case, it is necessary to provide confirmation of the source of funds.

For obtaining a STP license, you need to contribute a share capital of 125,000 euros, for a Market Maker license – 730,000 euros.

After a forex broker license is obtained, a legal entity is able to carry out the certification of its activities in any Eurozone country.

It requires submition of the appropriate set of documents to the Supervision Authority, that includes: the name of the state where he is going to operate, a business plan with detailed description of the activities and services with translation of the necessary documents certified by a sworn translator.

Managers of a Forex broker company

Only a person who have a university degree, experience and necessary professional qualifications to run a forex company and have an impeccable reputation can be elected or appointed as a head of forex company.

Forex company management must consist of at least two people.

Members of the board of a forex company must have completed higher education or an equivalent education, as well as necessary experience to run such a company.

In order to apply for an EFSA license, you must provide the following documents and information (some of them may relate to an existing company but not to a just established entity):

  • Memorandum or Resolution;
  • Articles of association
  • A document confirming the paid-up share capital;
  • A List of shareholders (with defining of their parts);
  • Information about the shareholders of the managing holding (if they exist);
  • Information about members of the board of directors and management (with detailed description);
  • Information about companies where the applicant or manager holds 20 or more percent of the shares (with detailed description);
  • Information about the applicant's auditor and persons conducting an internal control (with detailed description);
  • Financial information (a balance sheet, an income statement, annual reports if a company has been working);
  • Documents confirming the amount of the own capital with the auditor's report;
  • In the case of a holding ownership — a certificate issued by the supervisory authority of the relevant state is required, if the holding is owned by a foreign entity that is a subject of financial supervision. This certificate confirms that the defined foreign company has a valid license to operate;
    And, according to the supervisory authority, its activities do not contradict the current legislation;
  • A business plan;
  • Information about IT systems;
  • Description of the organizational structure;
  • Accounting policies and procedures;
  • The AML rules;
  • Other internal rules that are relevant to all regulated entities or specific services;

The EFSA inspection, application and review process takes approximately 6 months.

The cost of our company's services for the preparation and submission of a complete set of documents, including applications, internal rules, policies, other documents that are previously agreed for a license obtaining, participation in collection of all necessary documents, is from 20,000 Euro.

In the case of additional services, such as lengthy discussions on the business compliance with Estonian regulation, additional proceedings with EFSA (preparation of responses to their additional requestes, participation in meetings), an additional fee will be charged at hourly rates.

Forex Broker License in the Czech Republic

According to the Czech Republic legislation, the forex broker services are classified as “investment services”. Companies, operating as a Forex broker, need to obtain a special EFSA license, that is regulated by the Czech Republic Securities Market Act, that is regulated by the MIFID — the EU Markets in Financial Instruments Directive.

The Authorized capital Requirements for a forex broker license in the Czech Republic

1) 125,000 euros if the company provides the following services (a STP license):

  • portfolio management;
  • organization of securities offer or issue;
  • safekeeping and management of securities for the client, as well as related activities, including securities transfer and pledge and other actions related to the encumbrance of clients' securities and transfers for execution;

2) 730,000 euros if the company provides the following services (a Market Maker license):

  • transactions with securities at own expense;
  • securities ensuring or guaranteeing of its offer, issue or sale;
  • In each specific case, it is necessary to provide confirmation of the source of funds.

Also, there should be at least 2 board members with sufficient qualifications and education.

General organizational requirements to a staff

Founders of a forex broker company, who own 10% of its shares or more, should meet high qualifications and necessary knowledge in the investment services, as well as have experience of running a broker company.

The company employees must have sufficient skills, experience and competence to do the professional or official duties;

Forex company managers

Only a person who have a university degree, experience and necessary professional qualifications to run a forex company and have an impeccable reputation can be appointed as a forex company head.

The leadership of a forex company must consist of at least two members.

Members of board of a forex company must have completed higher education or an equivalent education, as well as a necessary experience to run such a company.

According to the law, an appropriate official is:

  • a forex company manager and forex agent;
  • a forex agent manager of a forex company;
  • an officer of a forex company and its forex agent who is involved in providing of investment or ancillary services or carrying out the investment transactions;
  • an individual who is involved in the provision of services to a forex company that are under the control of a forex company or its forex agent;
  • an individual who provides the services to a forex company or its forex agent under the agreement of operations transfer.
The price includes:
  • Registration of a company in the Czech Republic (local services are possible);
  • Drawing up and submitting the application for a license to the Czech National Bank;
  • Preparation of the appropriate company structure;
  • Drawing up a business plan for the company;
  • Preparation of the necessary manuals;
  • Preparation of the necessary company policies to be posted on the company's website;
  • Search for the suitable specialists in the Czech Republic who meet the criteria for a license obtaining;
  • Preparing of responses to additional inquiries from the Czech National Bank;
  • Preparation of the letters that accompany the application, if there are additional questions from the Czech National Bank;
  • Support the client in providing all the necessary documentation and information;
  • Opening a bank account of a company for forex activities;
  • Integration of a merchant account to the company's website.
Requirements for a place of a forex broker company
A company that has received a forex license in the Czech Republic must have an operating office in the Czech Republic.
A company that obtains a forex license should not have any subsidiaries, except ones that carry out the same investment activities.
License
validity
After a forex broker license is recieved in the Czech Republic, the company can further operate as a forex broker in other EU countries, having passed a simple certification procedure.
Timelines of a license obtaining
from 6 to 9 months (including preparation of documents)

Forex Broker License in Cape Verde

Cape Verde – Republic of Cape Verde – is a state in West Africa

Population is 520,502 people

Income level – below average

Capital – Praia

Further, there are a detailed information about the main steps of registering a business and obtaining a forex broker license in Cape Verde. The information includes the procedures, timelines and cost of starting a business and obtaining a license for a commercial enterprise.

  • Legal form: Sociedade por Quotas de Responsabilidade Limitada (LDA)
  • Paid up minimum share capital: 1 CVE
  • The city: Praia
Municipal license obtaining

Agency: The Municipality

There are two types of licenses in Cape Verde: a municipal license and an activity license. A municipal license is compulsory for all businesses that are operating in Praia. An inspection is usually carried out before the granting of a municipal license.

However, since the Decreto-Lei of 30/2009 has been adopted, an inspection of the municipality can be carried out a posteriori and an enterprise can start its activities before receiving the municipal license.

The license can be checked online through the following web portal:
lojacmp.com

A license obtaining – 8 days

An official duty – about 400 USD

An activity license, as the name implies, is obtained for the activity that the company is going to carry out. This license is optional for all companies. For example, if a commercial company does not conduct the export-import activities, there is no need to obtain such a license.

If a company applies for two licenses at once, the inspection of the Municipality is carried out by two inspectors.

A company name verification and reservation
Agency: The Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão)
Investors provide a proposed company name and activities. The verification is carried out by the Department of Trade Registry (Casa Do cidadão), that approves or rejects the names. The registry is computerized, so the verification process is very fast.
The Process – 1 day
Registration
of a company
Agency: The Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão)
After the authorized person goes to the Commercial Trade Department (Casa Do cidadão), the company is registered through the internal online registration form. The company incorporation notice is published on the Casa do Cidadão website. A company tax number is assigned automatically and free of charge.
The Process – 1 day
The Registration duty – about 200 USD
Making a deposit of the authorized capital to the bank
Agency: The Commercial Bank of Cape Verde
In practice, The Casa Do cidadão requires that founders make a deposit within two days of registration.
For companies that are not registered using the “Empresa no Dia” fast registration method, the minimum authorized capital is deposited to the bank before registration.
The Process – 1 day

Currency regime in Cape Verde

  • The Foreign Exchange Regulation (“Forex”) rules apply to all transactions between Forex residents and Forex non-residents, regardless of their nature (personal or business transactions).
  • Foreign currency transfers between a resident and non-resident company are subject to a Forex license, that varies depending on the types of transactions.
  • Forex transactions must be carried out through the local banks or financial institutions authorized to fulfil such transactions.
Registration of employees at the Social Security Directorate (Instituto nacional de previdência social)
Agency: The Social Security Agency (Instituto Nacional de Previdência)
Employee registration for an accident insurance
Agency: An Insurance company
The founders must insure workers against the accidents with any insurance company.
Timeline – 1 day
Registration of workers
in the labor inspectorate
Agency: The Labor Inspection
This procedure is mandatory if the company hires employees under an employment contract.
Timeline – 1 day
Receiving and processing of company's books
Agency: The Labor Inspection
Agency: The National Press (Imprensa Nacional)
These books can be purchased at the Imprensa Nacional. All pages must be signed by an authorized person.

***The last three points are carried out simultaneously with a license obtaining.

The Forex operations:
  • Opening of resident offshore bank account — Pre-approval
  • Payment for goods, current transactions and invisible elements of trading operations — Free

Forex Broker License in Australia

Forex brokers activities in Australia are regulated by the Corporations Act, 2001 and are considered as a subtype of the OTC contracts. Accordingly, buying and selling in the forex online market is also considered as a financial activity that can only be carried out in Australia with a special license.

Under the Corporations Act, the financial services companies must be incorporated and licensed in Australia.

Therefore, the activities of companies connected with the forex market are subject to be licensed.

In Australia, the forex companies are considered as the companies that provide financial services and are required to obtain an appropriate license, that indicates the services the company can provide.

The Section 3 of Part 7 of the Corporations Act contains a definition and list of financial services, according to which the financial services, listed in Section 4 of Part 4 of that Act, may be provided.

Providing of the financial services by a forex company to retail clients requires meeting all commitments to protect the interests of such clients. The Commission pays special attention to this fact in the case of making a decision to issue a license.

Timelines of obtaining a forex broker license in Australia
  • The application meets all legal requirements;
  • The applicant is able to ensure compliance with all the obligations that the license and legislation impose on him;
  • The applicant has the appropriate operating rules and procedures to ensure proper providing of financial services;
  • The applicant has concluded all the necessary agreements, treaties and contracts, that are essential for providing the proper financial services;
  • The applicant's managers and staff meet all the criteria that the commission sets for their education, knowledge and experience.
Fees
  • A Fee for license application review (one-time) is USD 1,485
  • A Fee for amending the terms of a valid license is USD 249
  • A Financial Reporting Fee is USD 549
  • A Fee for Notice of an Auditor Appointment is USD 36
  • An Annual license fee USD 1,086
The procedure for obtaining a Forex broker license in Australia

Filling out the forms of all founders, managers and key employees of the enterprise, as well as the necessary documentation confirming the powers of the persons, their experience and business knowledge; Filling of the FS01 application and accompanying papers.

In the application form, the person should choose the financial products, as well as the types of financial services that he intends to provide in relation to such products.

The applicant must also submit to the Commission the comprehensive evidence that confirms: the sufficient competence of his employees, a large amount of financial resources, as well as the commitment to ensuring all the license terms and all the legislation and the Commission requirements.

Inter alia, the Internal regulations and policies (for example, an anti-money laundering, a risk management, compliance with a license and legislation, etc.).

  • The Commission is entitled to require the applicant to provide any information and documents that it considers necessary;
  • A Business plan preparation;
  • At least 2 resident managers and an employee, who will oversee the compliance with all license conditions and legal requirements by the legal entity, should be appointed;
  • Submission of the documents to the regulator;
  • After the regulator's confirmation, it is necessary to make the insurance policies for liability to the Company's clients;
  • After all terms, indicated by the Commission in the preliminary decision of a license issuance, are met in the established timelines, the company will receive a license and can start its activities;
  • It is required to appoint an auditor and notify the Commission about it within a month.
The licensing authority control over the forex broker company activities in Australia

The Commission constantly monitors the Company activities, as well as controls its compliance with all license conditions and legal requirements.

A company that is considered as "a small" by the Australian legislation is required to submit the financial statements to the Commission within 1 month after the end of financial year and the audited financial statements with an independent auditor's conclusion within 3 months after the end of financial year.

A financial services company is considered as "a small" if it meets two or more of the following criteria:

  • The company's net assets do not exceed USD 5,000,000;
  • The company's gross income does not exceed USD 5,000,000;
  • A total number of employees does not exceed 20 people.

In other cases, the company is considered as medium or large and is required to submit financial statements to the Commission within 2 months after the end of financial year and the audited financial statements with an independent auditor conclusion within 4 months after the end of financial year.

The reasons for suspension and /or revocation of a forex broker license in Australia

The legislation imposes a clear list of the reasons for suspension and / or revocation of a license, particularly for:

  • violation of the laws, established regulation, the same in the case of submission the false information to the Commission;
  • non-compliance with the requirements of the Commission;
  • suspension or breaking off the financial services providing by the license holder for more than 6 months;
  • non-payment of the state fees.

of a forex broker company in Australia
Running business with the US residents is strictly prohibited. As for other regions, there are no legal restrictions.
However, a forex company, licensed by the Commission, must obtain its permission to operate on the territory of other states.
Customer Complaints
Procedure
The legislation set out that all customer complaints must be reviewed by the company (or an assigned employee), and the results of the complaint must be reported to the customer in a written form.
Futhermore, the company must have an internal regulation that describes in details the procedure for resolution of the disputes with customers.
The Company should inform all private clients of their right to make complaints against the Company to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.
Requirements
for the shareholders
The general requirement for shareholders of a forex company is knowledge of this type of financial services and being able to maintain the financial resources and assets of the company at any time, at least at the minimum required level.
According to the license obtaining practice, the Commission requires at least one shareholder of a forex company has experience in regulating a forex company in Australia or another jurisdiction for no less than 3 out of the last 5 years.
There are no legal requirements for the authorized capital

A Forex broker must keep the physical assets:

since January 31, 2014 – 10% of the annual income, but not less than USD 1,000,000, if the forex broker is not a dealing center;

5% of the annual income, but not less than USD 10,000,000 if the forex broker is a dealing center.

The company must have at least two Australian resident directors throughout the license period, an employee who will control the Company's compliance with all license conditions, the Commission and legal requirements, as well as a sufficient number of employees to provide the quality financial services.

The company should have a physical office in Australia. Using of the shell companies is prohibited.

The legislation contains special requirements for any information, including advertising, shared by a company. Thereby, a forex company must ensure that the information it shares is accurate and does not mislead the customers.

Penalties of a Forex broker in Australia

The Australian legislation does not contain a complete list of sanctions that the Commission and other regulatory authorities apply to the violators of the license terms and legislation of the forex company activities.

According to the legislation, the Commission has extensive powers in the choice of sanctions, that include administrative, civil and criminal liability, depending on the gravity of the offence and its consequences.

In the case of choosing the type of liability, the Commission pursues the following goals: a punishment of the offender and protection of the investor interests and his assets.

The Commission applies a wide range of measures to punish the offenders, that can include criminal liability in the form of imprisonment or community service for the serious misdeeds, and the civil or administrative penalties in the form of fines for less serious offenses.

Based on the investigation results, the Commission can independently determine the penalties level that apply to the company and its management, due to many factors. The minimum fine is USD 550 (for example, for the late submission of a financial report or notice to the Commission, required by law).

For a major offenses, the Commission, at its discretion, has the right to impose sanction to a forex company in the form of license revocation, as well as to impose fines up to USD 495,000 or thriple amount of the received benefit.

Moreover, the guilty company's official can be imprisoned for up to 10 years. The company's license may be revoked if the Commission has reasonable suspicions about the business reputation impeccability of any employees.

Cryptoexchange license in Singapore

Cryptocurrency exchange in Singapore. In recent years, Singapore has been one of the countries with the largest financial investments in the cryptocurrency market. This is due to the fact that the Singaporean legislation is one of the most loyal to the virtual currencies business.

Legal position of the authorities

Over the recent years, the cryptocurrency exchanges development in Singapore has intensified. Therefore, the Singapore Monetary and Financial Authority (MAS) was forced to express its position on this matter many times, as well as to explain some legal rules.

The MAS was loyal to the companies that deal just with the exchange of virtual currencies, since their activities can be carried out without a government licensing in Singapore.

At the same time, the companies that have conducted the ICOs and are involved in transactions with securities (most often with the digital tokens) are required to obtain an appropriate Singapore license, since the sphere of securities circulation is clearly regulated in Singapore by a special regulation.

So, as long as the activities of the intermediary company in Singapore do not treat with the securities market, but just exchange the virtual currencies, no licenses are required. Such attitude of financial management attracts cryptocurrency entrepreneurs from various countries.

Token as a security

A token is not always equated to securities, and therefore, the rules of the securities exchange do not always apply to its sale. However, in order to operate legally, it is important to know in what cases digital tokens act as securities.

The token is distributed to attract loans. In this case, the digital tokens are prove of the company debt that put the tokens to their holders. The token is an equivalent to a loan.

Digital markers are placed on the platform to attract investors. The holders of tokens are able to participate in the company management, as well as to get profits from its activities. In this case, the token is equated to shares.

These examples are the most common, but this list can be updated.

The main requirements for licensing of activities in Singapore

A licensing is a rather grave procedure. That is why a token trading company that want to license its activities in Singapore must meet a number of requirements:

  • a high level of security (it is necessary to ensure a full security of a platform from the unauthorized intrusions and funds secure);
  • should comply with the exchange rules for transparent admission to the trading;
  • an exact accounting of all operations, carried out on the platform;
  • do not commit any actions that violate the rights of platform users, but also create conditions for the confidential information;
  • record the violations of the law and report to the authorized bodies;
  • it is important to have an established risk-management system.
Criteria for a trustworthy cryptocurrency exchanger

A virtual currency exchange company must have a specific staff. The staff is headed by a general director, a chairman, board of directors.

For their part, the board of directors has a structured system consisting of various committees. Each of the committees is responsible for a specific area, for example, the staff appointments, the salary, the audits.

It is important to keep up

First of all, the cryptocurrency exchanges activities in Singapore must comply with regulations of fighting against an illegal money laundering, as well as financing of the terrorist organizations. Consequently, the token issuers are responsible for identifying the platform users.
