Licenses

إبدأ اليوم
Cryptocurrency license in the USA

Since the Money Laundering Control Act, 1994 was passed, the MSBs (Money Services Business) have to be registered with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) of the United States Department of the Treasury on a biennial basis.

In 2001, in an attempt to cope with the terrorist financing, the US Patriots Act expanded a federal regulation of the MSB, considered it as a federal crime to run a money transfer business without a money transfer license in any state that required such a license.

The court imposed an order to expand the concept of money transfer to include not only “a transfer of the actual money or currency”, but also “a transfer of the value of this currency through any other exchanger”.

The invention of Bitcoin in 2009 and a large number of the blockchain-based alternative cryptocurrencies have expanded both the benefits of these assets and the criminal interest for its using. In response, the FinCEN issued an explanatory guide for the virtual currency exchanges (the “FinCEN Guide”) on March 18, 2013.

The aim of the FinCEN Guidelines was “to explain the applicability of the rules implementation by the BSA (Bank Secrecy Act) to persons that create, receive, distribute, exchange, accept or transfer virtual currencies”. It pointed two categories of participants in the cryptocurrency industry: "exchangers" and "administrators".

Exchanger —

is a person or organization "engaged in the business of exchanging the virtual currency for the real currency, funds, or other virtual currency." A virtual currency administrator is a person or organization "engaged in business for issuance the virtual currency (putting into circulation) and has the right to buy back (withdrawn from circulation) such virtual currency."

The FinCEN's management concluded that the definition of a money transmitter does not distinguish the “real” and “virtual” currencies, “The acceptance and transmission of any value things in place of the currency, makes a person the money transmitter in accordance with the BSA regulations.”

Therefore, the exchangers and administrators are money transmitters that must be registered as the MSBs (unless they fall into the exception).

As the registered MSBs, these businesses are subject to the certain additional requirements under the BSA and its executive rules and must develop the safe anti-money laundering (“AML”) programs.

The federal government currently relies on powers under the 18 U.S.C. §1960 and the FinCEN guidance to monitor the cryptocurrency projects that are illegal.

Over the past two years, an increasing number of criminal complaints have been filed against the operation of unlicensed cryptocurrency MSBs in violation of the 1960 section. The Justice Department has started the cases in the states of Arizona, Colorado, Maine, Missouri, New York and Ohio.

For detailed information on licensing of the cryptocurrencies projects, please contact our specialist.

Cryptocurrency license in Malta

In order to apply for a license, the applicant must be a legal entity registered in Malta. If you just offer the investment advice services, an applicant may be a natural person residing in Malta. There should be at least 2 directors / managers in the company to fulfill the principle of "double control".

A System auditor

The MFSA may require the client to appoint a system auditor, as well as a system auditor to be in place at any time, even after a license is obrained. The system auditor is appointed / replaced subject to the prior approval from the MFSA.

The SA reviews / verifies client's DLT technology, makes an audit report and submits the copy to the MFSA. The MFSA may ask another SA to review / verify the DLT at any time.

The Services – Cryptocurrency License in Malta

The following VFA services require licenses for a DLT that has been identified as a virtual financial asset:

  • Taking and transmission of the orders: Receiving the orders for purchase, sale or subscription for the virtual financial assets and transfer the order to a third party to use.
  • Execution of the orders on behalf of others: entering into agreements to buy, sell or subscribe for the virtual financial assets on behalf of others.
  • Self-account: trading with equity, leading to transactions in the virtual financial assets.
  • Portfolio management: the management of assets owned by another person, if these assets include the virtual financial assets or their management mechanisms allow the person, who manages or agrees to manage these assets, has a right to invest any of these assets in the virtual financial assets. The term “assets” excludes any financial instrument, whether they are issued in Malta or not.
  • A Custodian or Local Services: (a) acting as a custodian or a local holder of the virtual financial asset and /or a secret key; or (b) having a virtual financial asset and /or a private cryptographic key as a local representative, if the person, acting as the local, performs the activities on behalf of another person who provides any VFA service on behalf of that person's client, and such a local holding is carried out in relation to this service.
  • Board of Investment: Providing, offering or concent to provide the investors or potential investors or the investor agents or potential investor with a personal recommendation in relation to one or more transactions with the virtual financial assets.
  • Virtual Financial Asset Offering: Marketing of re-issued virtual financial assets or virtual financial assets that have already been issued but are not admitted to trading on the DLT exchange, to the special entities and that are not connected with the offering to the public or the existing owners of the issuer's virtual financial assets.
  • VFA exchange operation.
Classes of licenses – the MFSA has the power to define the category the applicant party applies for

VFAA Class 1

  • Receiving and transferring the VFA orders; and / or
  • Providing an investment advice in terms of the VFA; and / or
  • VFA location

VFAA Class 2

  • Providing of any VFA services and holding or control of the clients' money, except for the VFA exchange operations or conduction of the personal account

VFAA Class 3

  • Providing of any VFA services and holding or control of clients' money, except for the VFA exchange operations

VFAA Class 4 – VFA Exchange

  • VFA Exchange Management;
  • Holding or managing of the client's money, the VFA and / or private cryptographic keys;
  • The custodian or local services just for the activity of such VFA exchange

A Licensing process

A VFA Services license application can only be made by an approved VFA agent.

Step 1: Submit a letter of intent to the MFSA including:

  • Description of the proposed structure
  • VFA service for which a license is requested
  • Identication of persons holding key positions
  • A Legal opinion that the proposed activity is not subject to the legislation on traditional financial services

Step 2: Participation in the compulsory pre-meeting at the MFSA offices

Step 3: Submit the application, the annexed documents to the commission within 60 days from the preliminary meeting
Once the documentation / information and assessment of propriety and correct qualifications meet the requirements, the MFSA issues an “official approval” valid for 3 months, during which the incomplete issues must be resolved

Step 4: The final license is issued

Step 5: It is necessary to start a business within 12 months from the date the license is issued

Requirements for a license
  • The application form must be completed and submitted
  • All documentation, required by the MFSA, must be completed and submitted, including a business plan, policies and procedures related to administration, compliance with the rules, risk management, security access systems and protocols, financial resources, capital adequacy, professional compensation insurance and any other documents, requested by the MFSA
  • The documents of a total legal expertise of the company must be submitted and the person, who owns and operates the company should be present
  • The company must be registered in Malta. If it is not registered in Malta, it must be incorporated into a recognized jurisdiction, provided that a branch is also established in Malta and meet all the requirements, set by the MFSA
  • The company must be managed by at least two individuals for a "dual control"
  • The company facilities must be limited to run as a license holder, providing the VFA services – the company cannot carry out any other activity that is licensed by another law
  • Payment of duties

All licensees will be posted on a public online registry.

The license holder should start to provide the authorized services within 12 months from the date a license was issued, otherwise a license will be canceled.

Suitability and quality assessment

The suitability and quality assessment applies to:

  • The persons, holding at least 10% of direct / indirect interest in the company
  • Voluntary owners
  • Board members
  • A Senior manager
  • The MLRO – must be a BoA member or a compliance officer
  • A Compliance Officer (Compliance function can be performed by a VFA agent) – can also act as the MLRO
  • A Risk manager (if it is relevant)
  • Anyone else who runs a VFA business effectively

He must represent the PQ and have an appropriate level of qualifications, professional knowledge and experience. It is also necessary to prove that you spend enough time for the proper execution of activity.

Crypto-exchanger license in Labuan

Crypto-exchanger license in Labuan. Today Labuan attracts investors, who are organizing the cryptocurrency exchange. It is possible to start your own commercial business with the foreign management in this jurisdiction.

The crypto exchange is controled by the Labuan Financial Services Authority.

In order to conduct business properly after a license obtaining, you will need to comply with all the rules and laws of Malaysia, especially the law on fighting on using the funds or property, obtained illegaly.

The entrepreneurs are entitled to make their own scheme for exchanges with using an electronic wallet. The scheme can include such types of services as an exchange of one type of cryptocurrency to another; an exchange of fiat currency to cryptocurrency and vice versa.

Benefits of obtaining a cryptocurrency exchange license in Labuan.
  • The foreign property. There is no requirements for the Malaysian local founders.
  • An income tax is only 3%. It can also be a fixed amount of 5 thousand US dollars.
  • There is no taxes for: an interest, royalties, licensing fee, maintenance, capital gains, legacy, dividends.
  • No currency control.
  • No tax on property purchasing (a stamp duty).
  • No import duty.

In addition, the entrepreneurs who have received permission for a crypto exchange in Labuan are able to:

  • use more than 70 agreements of Malaysia to avoid the double taxation;
  • reduce taxes for the foreign employees by 50% (as for the directors, they are completely exempt from paying taxes);
  • get a work visa in Malaysia for two years.

There are a number of requirements that must be met by every entrepreneur who wants to obtain a permition:

  • an active permission to exchange cryptocurrency in another jurisdiction (if any);
  • a work experience of at least 1-2 years.
  • a proof of the deposited funds in the amount of USD 1 million.

Registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic

Registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic. A cryptocurrency is a digital currency, controlled by the cryptographic methods (an international electronic money, created on the base of a data encryption).

A fiat is a traditional currency (dollar, euro, pound) that has a physical shape in the form of banknotes and coins. Benefits: Officially recognized currency, exchangeable at a fixed equivalent. Disadvantages: Less protected from the decentralization factors, compared to a cryptocurrency. It is controled from the states.

The earned crypto money is stored on the blockchain, an encrypted chain of the algorithms, that is divided into blocks, and stored on several computers at the same time. The principle of operation is similar to the files download programs, i.e. torrent.

For the last years, the popularity and demand for cryptocurrencies has caused a growing interest in the crypto industry. In order to establish the companies in this area, a crypto exchange / crypto wallet / ICO, a license is required.

The Czech Republic is one of the European countries with the advanced economic and political trends. Here you can easily pay for any goods and services with cryptocurrency – food, housing, clothing, leisure, etc.

What is required for registration?

First of all, you should choose and check the name for your crypto company. After that, a package of documents, including a certificate of no criminal record, is required to identify the future owner. A legal address is necessary.

The validity period is one year. It is followed by opening an account for a business, recruiting the employees, purchasing the software and technical equipment.

At the last stages of registration, you need to have a complete package of company's documents, pay the state fee and submit the gathered documents to the proper state authorities.

The Czech government's opinion about the crypto business in the Czech Republic

The Czech laws considers the digital currency not as a monetary unit, but as a product. A crypto business in the Czech Republic does not need a license, but it is possible to obtain a license for the international work with cryptocurrency – the EMI.

Digital money is not subject to special taxes, but the VAT is charged on payments with cryptocurrency. Otherwise, a legal entity – the customer should pay the value added tax instead of his supplier.

The Czech National Bank opinion about the cryptocurrency and related activities

The CNB says that bitcoin is not a cashless currency. Accordingly, a cryptocurrency is a symbolic money that does not have a fixed value, in contrast to the officially recognized currencies.

The bitcoins exchange is not a currency one, therefore, the CNB does not control the activities with cryptocurrency.

The head of the currency control department of the CNB expressed the concern that the bitcoin will become a tool to bypass payment sanctions for online games. Therefore, the Ministry of Finance was asked to modernize the regulation about the control of gambling.

What should be born in mind for registering the cryptocurrency activities in the Czech Republic?

With the high popularity and extensive use of cryptocurrency, it is not under the jurisdiction of the state. Moreover, the CNB imposed a ban on opening an account for crypto exchangers and crypto exchanges.

Therefore, it is necessary to open the cryptocurrency accounts for companies outside the Czech Republic, in another jurisdiction.

It is important to take into account the requirements of the Czech Ministry of Finance, according to which the cryptocurrency activities are impossible without verification of the identity of each participant in this process.

The law obliges the sellers and buyers of a cryptocurrency in the Czech Republic to comply with the KYC and AMI standards strictly.

The requirements are caused by the fear of the state about the number of the tax evaders, fraudulent activities in the field of finance and a terrorism.

Options of Solution – registration of a crypto exchanger in the Czech Republic

An alternative option for a crypto exchanger / crypto exchange registration is other countries with more progressive terms.
For example:

  • The UK – the cryptocurrency legislation have not been amended yet, but the state does not hinder a crypto activity in all forms. It is possible to withdraw the digital money into fiat money.
  • Estonia – issues licenses for all existing operations with cryptocurrency.
  • Malta – 3 regulations were recently adopted: on virtual financial assets, on innovative technologies and services, and on digital innovation operations (The Virtual Financial Assets Act, the VFA; The Innovative Technology Arrangements and Services Act; The Malta Digital Innovation Authority Act. the MDIA).
  • Luxembourg – issues the EMI licenses, that include all the ability for cryptocurrencies operations.
  • Switzerland – depending on the project, it issues a license either the FINMA or the SRO.
  • Belarus – issues licenses for crypto activities, but asks not to withdraw funds outside the country.

The Japanese crypto business is considered to be the leading and most expensive in terms of the number of government exchanges. An American license is specific and concretized for each separate type of activity with the digital money.

Thereby, a state for registering a crypto business should be chosen extremely careful. Competent experts of the Acalista group will help you decide on the options.

License for a cryptocurrency company in Switzerland

License for a cryptocurrency company in Switzerland. Switzerland is considered the world leader in financial transactions and operations.

The country's leadership pays attention to the legislation reforming, based on the situation with the development of the cryptocurrency business and blockchain. The non-fiat currencies got a legal status in 2014.

Cryptocurrencies have been recognized as a digital form of value, such a monetary value can be bought and sold through the Internet channels. This event was recorded in the report of the Federal Council of the country. So, cryptocurrencies were officially recognized as the assets.

It became the basis for the online money industry licensing. The first license was issued in 2017. The exchanger received the status of an intermediary (DSFI), that gave it the right to serve the qualified investors.

لاw, the crypto exchangers and ICOs have the opportunity to pool funds. The functional responsibilities of the FINMA regulator have also been expanded.

It monitors the activities of organizations whose work is related to the non-fiat funds, warns the possible risks, prevents the emergence of the unauthorized business models, and fights the fraud.

Legalization of the crypto business is carried out by the Financial Market Supervisory Authority. The relevant amendments were also made to the Banking Regulations. The government regulation in the field of online currencies reached a new level in 2018.

The State Secretariat for International Finance has created a working group for direct cooperation with the FINMA. Due to the new rules, firms that use the blockchain and exchange technologies on a small scale will not be verified by the official bodies.

The exchanges that are not licensed to conduct the cryptocurrency transactions must comply with the generally accepted regulations.

Responsibilities of the Swiss exchangers

Companies that conduct the ICO operations, cryptocurrency trading in any form, should work according to the established rules. The company must:

  • fight against a money laundering: the legal entities dealing with deposit assets must follow this law – an identity verification and authentication of the buyer and sender of funds are required;
  • discourage the terrorism and comply with all accepted CFT rules;
  • ensure the complete safety of client funds in order to be credible – this is prescribed by the European KYC regulations;
  • conduct a correct tax policy – crypto funds are considered as a foreign currency. Obtaining a license to conduct transactions with non-fiat funds implies a timely payment of taxes on a general basis. The capital gains are not taxed.
